chisen: 這家公司的商業前景看起來非常光明。
engsen: The commercial future of the company looks very promising .

chi: （代表較大的組織決策或搜集資訊的）委員會
eng: a small group of people chosen to represent a larger organization and either make decisions or collect information for it
chisen: 她是學校發展委員會的成員。
engsen: She sits on/is on the school's development committee .

chi: （代表較大的組織決策或搜集資訊的）委員會
eng: a small group of people chosen to represent a larger organization and either make decisions or collect information for it
chisen: 當地市政會剛剛成立了一個研究資源再利用問題的委員會。
engsen: The local council has just set up a committee to study recycling .

chi: （代表較大的組織決策或搜集資訊的）委員會
eng: a small group of people chosen to represent a larger organization and either make decisions or collect information for it
chisen: 委員會會議
engsen: a committee meeting

eng: to share information with others by speaking, writing, moving your body, or using other signals
chisen: 我們現在可以與生活在地球另一端的人進行即時交流。
engsen: We can now communicate instantly with people on the other side of the world .

eng: to share information with others by speaking, writing, moving your body, or using other signals
chisen: 那種語言他一竅不通，只好用手勢來溝通。
engsen: Unable to speak a word of the language , he communicated with (= using) his hands .

eng: to share information with others by speaking, writing, moving your body, or using other signals
chisen: 消息傳達給員工了嗎？
engsen: Has the news been communicated to the staff yet ?

eng: If one room communicates with another, it connects with it through a door.
chisen: 臥室與廁所和門廳都是相通的。
engsen: The bedroom communicates with both bathroom and hall .

eng: the act of comparing two or more people or things
chisen: 他們對不同國家的飲食習慣作了一番比較。
engsen: They made a comparison of different countries' eating habits .

eng: the act of comparing two or more people or things
chisen: 與法國人相比，英國人吃魚要少得多。
engsen: By/In comparison with the French , the British eat far less fish .

eng: the fact of considering something similar or of equal quality to something else
chisen: 她把軍隊生活比作坐牢。
engsen: She drew a comparison between life in the army and life in prison .

eng: the fact of considering something similar or of equal quality to something else
chisen: 在我心目中，這兩家飯店根本不能相比。
engsen: To my mind there's no comparison between the two restaurants (= one is much better than the other) .

eng: the fact of considering something similar or of equal quality to something else
chisen: 他是位好作家，但無法與莎士比亞相提並論。
engsen: He's a good writer but he doesn't bear/stand comparison with Shakespeare (= he is not nearly as good as Shakespeare) .

eng: to try to be more successful than someone or something else
chisen: 小超市很難與大超市競爭。
engsen: It's difficult for a small shop to compete against/with the big supermarkets .

eng: to try to be more successful than someone or something else
chisen: 兩個女孩在父親面前爭寵。
engsen: Both girls compete for their father's attention .

eng: to try to be more successful than someone or something else
chisen: 把音樂調小聲一點——我可不想跟那噪音較量！
engsen: Turn the music down - I'm not competing against/with that noise (= I can't/won't try to speak louder than that music) !

eng: a statement that something is wrong or not satisfactory
chisen: 我們收到了一位聽眾有關用語粗俗的投訴。
engsen: We've received a complaint from one of our listeners about offensive language .

eng: a statement that something is wrong or not satisfactory
chisen: 我向警方投訴了噪音問題。
engsen: I've made a complaint (= formally complained) to the police about the noise .

eng: a statement that something is wrong or not satisfactory
chisen: 我們接到投訴說你們的收音機音量開得太大。
engsen: We've had complaints that you've been playing your radio too loud .

eng: an illness
chisen: 心臟／胃病
engsen: a heart/stomach complaint

chi: 由許多相關的不同部分組成的；構造複雜的
eng: involving a lot of different but related parts
chisen: 複雜的分子／碳水化合物
engsen: a complex molecule/carbohydrate

chi: 由許多相關的不同部分組成的；構造複雜的
eng: involving a lot of different but related parts
chisen: 錯綜複雜的道路網
engsen: a complex network of roads

chi: 由許多相關的不同部分組成的；構造複雜的
eng: involving a lot of different but related parts
chisen: 複雜的程序
engsen: a complex procedure

eng: to cause worry to someone
chisen: 我父親的健康狀況讓我們非常擔心。
engsen: The state of my father's health concerns us greatly .

eng: to cause worry to someone
chisen: 還沒有聯絡到他，我很擔心。
engsen: It concerns me that he hasn't been in contact .

chi: 對…很重要；與…相關；涉及到…，關係到…
eng: to be important to someone or to involve someone directly
chisen: 污染和環境的問題與我們所有人都息息相關。
engsen: Matters of pollution and the environment concern us all .

chi: 對…很重要；與…相關；涉及到…，關係到…
eng: to be important to someone or to involve someone directly
chisen: 我要跟埃米說的事與你無關。
engsen: What I have to say to Amy doesn't concern you .

eng: a performance of music by one or more musicians or singers
chisen: 流行／古典音樂會
engsen: a pop/classical concert

eng: a performance of music by one or more musicians or singers
chisen: 學校音樂會
engsen: a school concert

eng: to end a speech, meeting, or piece of writing
chisen: 她在演講結束時提醒我們所承擔的責任。
engsen: She concluded the speech by reminding us of our responsibility .

eng: to end a speech, meeting, or piece of writing
chisen: 在結束發言前，我想感謝諸位的光臨。
engsen: Before I conclude , I'd like to thank you all for coming .

eng: to end a speech, meeting, or piece of writing
chisen: 音樂會以激動人心的大合唱結束。
engsen: The concert concluded with a rousing chorus .

chi: 斷定；決定；推斷出；作出（結論）
eng: to judge or decide something after thinking carefully about it
chisen: 陪審團依據證據裁決被告無罪。
engsen: The jury concluded from the evidence that the defendant was innocent .

chi: 斷定；決定；推斷出；作出（結論）
eng: to judge or decide something after thinking carefully about it
chisen: 一直談到深夜，可是沒有作出任何決定。
engsen: The discussions continued late into the night , but nothing was concluded .

eng: the final part of something
chisen: 注意不要在你的論文結論部分引入新的想法。
engsen: Be careful not to introduce new ideas in the conclusion of your essay .

eng: the act of arranging or agreeing something formally
chisen: 協議的達成／條約的締結
engsen: the conclusion of the deal/treaty

eng: the opinion you have after considering all the information about something
chisen: 今天上午的會議上你們有沒有得出甚麼結論？
engsen: Did you come to/reach/draw any conclusions at the meeting this morning ?

eng: the opinion you have after considering all the information about something
chisen: 起初我以為他有點害羞，可是後來我斷定他就是不友好！
engsen: At first I thought he was a bit shy , but I've come to the conclusion that he's simply unfriendly !

eng: the particular state that something or someone is in
chisen: 媽媽還留著我們的嬰兒車——雖然很舊了，但仍然完好。
engsen: Mum's still got our pram - it's very old , but it's in perfect condition .

eng: the particular state that something or someone is in
chisen: 他們把公寓房間弄得一團糟——到處一片狼藉。
engsen: They left the flat in a terrible condition - there was mess everywhere .

eng: the particular state that something or someone is in
chisen: 醫院說她的健康狀況正在慢慢好轉。
engsen: The hospital say her condition (= state of health) is improving slowly .

eng: an arrangement that must exist before something else can happen
chisen: 合同條款之一是我們不在這片土地上建造樓房。
engsen: One of the conditions in the contract is that we don't build on the land .

eng: an arrangement that must exist before something else can happen
chisen: 我們沒有資格提出任何條件——我們只能接受他們提供的一切。
engsen: We're not in a position to make/set any conditions - we'll have to accept what they offer us .

eng: an arrangement that must exist before something else can happen
chisen: 根據協定條款，她必須在7月12日騰出這所房子。
engsen: Under the conditions of the agreement , she must vacate the house on 12 July  .

eng: a shape with a flat, round or oval base and a top that becomes narrower until it forms a point
chisen: 錐形交通路標
engsen: a traffic cone

eng: a container made of very light thin biscuit, or one of these containing ice cream
chisen: 錐形霜淇淋筒
engsen: an ice cream cone

chi: 自信的；有信心的；確信的；有把握的；信任的
eng: having confidence
chisen: 你應該再自信一點！
engsen: Be a bit more confident in yourself !

chi: 自信的；有信心的；確信的；有把握的；信任的
eng: having confidence
chisen: 他們聽起來對該行業的未來信心不足。
engsen: They don't sound confident about the future of the industry .

chi: 自信的；有信心的；確信的；有把握的；信任的
eng: having confidence
chisen: 我對他作經紀人很有信心。
engsen: I'm confident of his skills as a manager .

eng: to mix up someone's mind or ideas, or to make something difficult to understand
chisen: 你把他搞糊塗了！慢慢跟他講，一次說一件事。
engsen: You're confusing him ! Tell him slowly and one thing at a time .

eng: to mix up someone's mind or ideas, or to make something difficult to understand
chisen: 別再把事情越搞越亂！
engsen: Stop confusing the issue (= making the problem unnecessarily difficult) !

eng: to join or be joined with something else
chisen: 我能把我的印表機連接到你的電腦上嗎？
engsen: Can I connect my printer to your computer ?

eng: to join or be joined with something else
chisen: 這個爐子在哪裡連接電源？
engsen: Where does the stove connect (up) to the electricity ?

eng: to join or be joined with something else
chisen: 你們的新居接通電話／電／煤氣／網際網路了嗎？
engsen: Has the phone/electricity/gas/internet been connected (= switched on or joined to the main supply) in your new place yet ?

eng: to consider or show a person or thing to be related to someone or something else
chisen: 這個女演員讓我聯想到的是戲劇而不是電影。
engsen: She's an actress I connect with the theatre rather than films .

eng: to consider or show a person or thing to be related to someone or something else
chisen: 警方正把這宗入室行竊案和近期該地區其他失竊案聯繫起來。
engsen: Police are connecting the break-in with other recent thefts in the area .

eng: to feel close to someone or have a good relationship with them
chisen: 她有一種非凡的能力，可以與各種各樣的人建立起良好關係。
engsen: She has a remarkable ability to connect with a wide variety of people .

eng: to feel close to someone or have a good relationship with them
chisen: 我們就是合不來。
engsen: We just didn't connect .

eng: to make it possible for you to speak to someone else by phone
chisen: 能幫我接通巴黎的一個號碼嗎？我好像打不通。
engsen: Could you connect me with/to a number in Paris , please ? I'm not getting through .

eng: If two buses, trains, etc. connect, they arrive at times that allow passengers to get off one and onto another.
chisen: 您的航班十點半到達，那裡有聯運長途客車到您入住的飯店。
engsen: Your flight arrives at 12.30 , when it connects with a bus service to your hotel .

eng: If two buses, trains, etc. connect, they arrive at times that allow passengers to get off one and onto another.
chisen: 機場和該市之間有火車聯運。
engsen: There's a connecting train service between the airport and the city .

eng: the state of being related to someone or something else
chisen: 吸煙和心臟病之間的聯繫已為人們所熟知。
engsen: The connection between smoking and heart disease is well known .

eng: the state of being related to someone or something else
chisen: 她們是姐妹，是不是？我知道她們同姓，可從沒想過她們是一家。
engsen: They're sisters ? I knew their surname was the same , but I never made (= thought of) the connection .

eng: the act of joining or being joined to something else, or the part or process that makes this possible
chisen: 電力公司保證24小時內通電。
engsen: The electricity company guarantees connection within 24 hours .

eng: the act of joining or being joined to something else, or the part or process that makes this possible
chisen: 難怪你的充電器不充電，插頭接線松了。
engsen: No wonder your charger isn't working . There's a loose connection (= a connecting wire has become loose) in the plug .

eng: the way that two people can speak to each other by phone
chisen: 對不起，請重複一遍，好嗎？通話效果太差了。
engsen: Sorry , could you repeat that ? This is a very bad connection .

chi: （供中轉旅客換乘的）接駁交通工具（如公車、火車、飛機等）
eng: a bus, train, plane, etc. that arrives at a time that allows passengers to get on after getting off another one, so that they can continue their journey
chisen: 如果航班晚點，我們會錯過轉機。
engsen: If the flight is late , we'll miss our connection .

eng: to notice that a particular thing or person exists or is present
chisen: 牙齒並不痛 ，可是我總覺得不舒服。
engsen: My tooth doesn't exactly hurt , but I'm conscious of it (= I can feel it) all the time .

eng: to notice that a particular thing or person exists or is present
chisen: 我想她對於自己是辦公室裡唯一沒有受過大學教育的人這一點很敏感。
engsen: I think she's very conscious of being the only person in the office who didn't have a university education .

eng: to notice that a particular thing or person exists or is present
chisen: 他漸漸意識到其他人都是穿著西裝。
engsen: He gradually became conscious (of the fact) that everyone else was wearing a suit .

chi: 有意識的；神志清醒的；有知覺的
eng: awake, thinking, and knowing what is happening around you
chisen: 他神志還清醒，但傷得很重。
engsen: He's still conscious but he's very badly injured .

chi: 有意識的；神志清醒的；有知覺的
eng: awake, thinking, and knowing what is happening around you
chisen: 她已經出了手術室，可是還沒有完全清醒。
engsen: She's out of the operating theatre , but she's not fully conscious yet .

chi: 有意識的；神志清醒的；有知覺的
eng: awake, thinking, and knowing what is happening around you
chisen: 「我可以跟伊索貝爾通話嗎？」「她還沒起床，我去看看她醒了沒有。」
engsen: "Can I speak to Isobel , please?" "She's still in bed . I'll go and see if she's conscious (= awake) yet."

eng: determined and intentional
chisen: 他此刻顯然是在有意討好我。
engsen: He's obviously making a conscious effort to be nice to me at the moment .

eng: determined and intentional
chisen: 我沒有刻意減肥，就瘦下來了。
engsen: It wasn't a conscious decision to lose weight . It just happened .

chi: 相當大的；相當多的；非常可觀的；相當重要的
eng: large or of noticeable importance
chisen: 那場火災給教堂造成了重大損失。
engsen: The fire caused considerable damage to the church .

eng: the act of thinking about something carefully
chisen: 一番斟酌之後，我們決定賣掉房子。
engsen: After some consideration , we've decided to sell the house .

eng: the act of thinking about something carefully
chisen: 整件事需要仔細考慮。
engsen: The whole matter needs (to be given) careful consideration .

chi: 考慮（或注意）的事（或因素、原因）
eng: a particular subject or fact that needs to be thought about when judging something
chisen: 舒適性／安全性是需考慮的重要因素。
engsen: Comfort/Safety is an important consideration .

eng: behaviour that is kind and considers people's feelings
chisen: 你毫不關心別人！
engsen: You have no consideration for others !

eng: behaviour that is kind and considers people's feelings
chisen: 把你的音樂聲量調低，考慮一下鄰居！
engsen: Turn your music down and show a little consideration for the neighbours !

eng: behaviour that is kind and considers people's feelings
chisen: 出於對受害者家屬的考慮，我們沒有公佈細節。
engsen: We didn't publish the details , out of consideration for the victim's family .

eng: a payment for a service
chisen: 先生，如果給點報酬，我會親自帶您到那裡。
engsen: For a small consideration , sir , I'll show you the way there myself .

chi: 經常發生的；連續發生的；連續不斷的
eng: happening a lot or all the time
chisen: 他與警方麻煩不斷。
engsen: He's in constant trouble with the police .

chi: 經常發生的；連續發生的；連續不斷的
eng: happening a lot or all the time
chisen: 經常使用的機器
engsen: machines that are in constant use

eng: staying the same, or not getting less or more
chisen: 我們保持了比較平穩的跑動速度。
engsen: We ran at a fairly constant speed .

eng: staying the same, or not getting less or more
chisen: 冰箱在恆溫下保存食物。
engsen: The fridge keeps food at a constant temperature .

eng: one of the seven large land masses on the earth's surface, surrounded, or mainly surrounded, by sea and usually consisting of various countries
chisen: 北美大陸
engsen: the North American continent

eng: one of the seven large land masses on the earth's surface, surrounded, or mainly surrounded, by sea and usually consisting of various countries
chisen: 亞非兩洲
engsen: the continents of Asia and Africa

eng: a legal document that states and explains a formal agreement between two different people or groups, or the agreement itself
chisen: 僱用合同
engsen: a contract of employment

eng: a legal document that states and explains a formal agreement between two different people or groups, or the agreement itself
chisen: 臨時／建築合同
engsen: a temporary/building contract

eng: a legal document that states and explains a formal agreement between two different people or groups, or the agreement itself
chisen: 如果你違反合同（條款），他們可以起訴你。
engsen: They could take legal action against you if you break (the terms of) the contract .

chi: （名詞）可數的（可以與 a 或 an 連用，也有複數形式）
eng: a countable noun can be used with "a" or "an" and can be made plural
chisen: 例如 table 是可數名詞，money 是不可數名詞。
engsen: An example of a countable noun is "table" , and an example of an uncountable noun is "money" .

eng: a person who is not brave and is too eager to avoid danger, difficulty, or pain
chisen: 她在審訊中告發了同事，因此被視為懦夫。
engsen: They branded her a coward for informing on her colleagues during the interrogation .

eng: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves from side to side
chisen: 保姆搖動搖籃。
engsen: The nurse rocked the cradle .

eng: If a vehicle crashes or someone crashes it, it is involved in an accident, usually a serious one in which the vehicle is damaged and someone is hurt.
chisen: 我們在冰上打滑撞了（另一輛）車。
engsen: We skidded on the ice and crashed .

eng: If a vehicle crashes or someone crashes it, it is involved in an accident, usually a serious one in which the vehicle is damaged and someone is hurt.
chisen: 飛機撞到了山坡上。
engsen: The plane crashed into a mountainside .

eng: If a vehicle crashes or someone crashes it, it is involved in an accident, usually a serious one in which the vehicle is damaged and someone is hurt.
chisen: 她弟弟借用她的機車，結果給撞壞了。
engsen: Her brother borrowed her motorbike and crashed it .

chi: （使）猛撞（常發出巨大聲響或造成破壞）
eng: to hit something, often making a loud noise or causing damage
chisen: 我們能聽到海浪嘩嘩地拍打著海岸。
engsen: We could hear waves crashing on/against the shore .

chi: （使）猛撞（常發出巨大聲響或造成破壞）
eng: to hit something, often making a loud noise or causing damage
chisen: 突然，鐃鈸聲砰然響起，樂隊開始了演奏。
engsen: Suddenly , cymbals crashed and the orchestra began playing .

chi: （使）猛撞（常發出巨大聲響或造成破壞）
eng: to hit something, often making a loud noise or causing damage
chisen: 狗嗖的一聲躥過灌木叢。
engsen: A dog came crashing through the bushes .

eng: If something such as a business crashes, it suddenly fails or becomes unsuccessful.
chisen: 股市開始狂跌，投資者們人心惶惶。
engsen: Investors were seriously worried when the stock market began to crash .

chi: （尤指事先無計劃而留在別人家裡）過夜，睡覺
eng: to sleep at someone else's house for the night, especially when you have not planned it
chisen: 派對後他們在我家打了地鋪。
engsen: They crashed on my floor after the party .

eng: to go to a party or other event without an invitation
chisen: 我們想闖進去參加派對，可是保安攔住了我們。
engsen: We tried to crash the party , but the bouncers wouldn't let us in .

chi: 緩慢移動；艱難前行；爬行；匍匐前進
eng: to move slowly or with difficulty, especially with your body stretched out along the ground or on hands and knees
chisen: 那個孩子爬過了地板。
engsen: The child crawled across the floor .

chi: 緩慢移動；艱難前行；爬行；匍匐前進
eng: to move slowly or with difficulty, especially with your body stretched out along the ground or on hands and knees
chisen: 受傷的士兵慢慢爬向安全的地方。
engsen: The injured soldier crawled to safety .

chi: 緩慢移動；艱難前行；爬行；匍匐前進
eng: to move slowly or with difficulty, especially with your body stretched out along the ground or on hands and knees
chisen: 梅甘剛學會爬。
engsen: Megan has just learned to crawl .

chi: 巴結，討好；阿諛奉承；卑躬屈膝
eng: to try hard to please in order to get an advantage
chisen: 我不喜歡卑躬屈膝的人。
engsen: I don't like people who crawl .

chi: 巴結，討好；阿諛奉承；卑躬屈膝
eng: to try hard to please in order to get an advantage
chisen: 因為想得到提升，他對集團領導阿諛奉承。
engsen: He crawled to the group leader because he wanted a promotion .

eng: to be completely covered with or full of a particular type of thing
chisen: 收到炸彈恐嚇後，機場佈滿了警察。
engsen: After the bomb scare , the airport was crawling with police .

chi: 有創造力的；創造性的；有創意的
eng: producing or using original and unusual ideas
chisen: 有創意的人／藝術家／設計師／程式設計員
engsen: a creative person/artist/designer/programmer

eng: someone who has invented something
chisen: 他成功創作了一系列卡通作品。

chi: 遵守，奉行（法律、規則或習俗）
eng: to obey a law, rule, or custom

engsen: Do you observe Passover ?

chi: 清楚的；顯然的，明顯的；明白的
eng: easy to see, recognize, or understand
chisen: 顯然她不喜歡他。
engsen: It's obvious (that) she doesn't like him .

chi: 清楚的；顯然的，明顯的；明白的
eng: easy to see, recognize, or understand
chisen: 他們有個年幼的孩子，所以顯然很需要錢。
engsen: They have a small child so for obvious reasons they need money .

chi: 清楚的；顯然的，明顯的；明白的
eng: easy to see, recognize, or understand
chisen: 我知道你不喜歡她，但有必要表現得那麼露骨嗎？
engsen: I know you don't like her , but do you have to make it so obvious ?

eng: a particular time, especially when something happens or has happened
chisen: 我們幾次會面討論這個問題。
engsen: We met on several occasions to discuss the issue .

eng: a particular time, especially when something happens or has happened
chisen: 我有好幾次聽到他對她說話很粗魯。
engsen: I've heard him be rude to her on a number of occasions .

eng: a particular time, especially when something happens or has happened
chisen: 我好像記得那一次他和她的妻子在一起。
engsen: I seem to remember that on that occasion he was with his wife .

chi: 奇怪的，古怪的；異常的；出人意料的
eng: strange or unexpected
chisen: 她父親是個古怪的人。
engsen: Her father was an odd man .

chi: 奇怪的，古怪的；異常的；出人意料的
eng: strange or unexpected
chisen: 這樣說太奇怪了。
engsen: What an odd thing to say .

chi: 奇怪的，古怪的；異常的；出人意料的
eng: strange or unexpected

engsen: The skirt and jacket looked a little odd together .

eng: not happening often
chisen: 她有時教教課，但並不固定。
engsen: She does the odd teaching job but nothing permanent .

eng: not happening often

engsen: You get the odd person who's rude to you but they're generally quite helpful .

eng: (of numbers) not able to be divided exactly by two
chisen: 3， 5， 7都是奇數。
engsen: 3 , 5 , and 7 are all odd numbers .

eng: (of numbers) not able to be divided exactly by two
chisen: 街道這邊的房子都是單號的。
engsen: The houses on this side of the street all have odd numbers .

chi: （指一對或一組事物中）單個的，單只的，不成對的
eng: (of something that should be in a pair or set) separated from its pair or set
chisen: 他有一抽屜的單只襪子。
engsen: He's got a whole drawer full of odd socks .

chi: （指一對或一組事物中）單個的，單只的，不成對的
eng: (of something that should be in a pair or set) separated from its pair or set

engsen: I'd got a few odd (= I had various) balls of wool left over .

eng: used to show movement into or on a particular place
chisen: 我登上月臺的時候，滑了一跤。
engsen: I slipped as I stepped onto the platform .

eng: used to show movement into or on a particular place
chisen: 羊被裝上了貨車。
engsen: The sheep were loaded onto trucks .

chi: （用於表示開始談論另一話題）
eng: used about changing to, or starting to talk about, a different subject
chisen: 我們是怎麼談到這個話題的？
engsen: How did we get onto this subject ?

chi: （用於表示開始談論另一話題）
eng: used about changing to, or starting to talk about, a different subject
chisen: 我們可以進行議程的下一項內容嗎？
engsen: Can we move onto the next item on the agenda ?

eng: to keep holding something
chisen: 抓住我的手，你會十分安全的。
engsen: Hold onto my hand and you'll be perfectly safe .

chi: 知道，了解，發現（能從中獲益的人或事物）
eng: knowing about someone or something that can be useful to you
chisen: 你碰上好事了，商店裡有買一送一的活動。
engsen: You're onto a good thing with this buy-one-get-one-free deal .

chi: 知道，了解，發現（能從中獲益的人或事物）
eng: knowing about someone or something that can be useful to you
chisen: 大衛給我介紹了一家非常好的餐館。
engsen: David put me onto (= told me about) a really good restaurant .

chi: 跟…說（尤指要求某人做事或向其抱怨）
eng: If you are onto someone, you talk to that person, especially to ask them to do something, or to complain to them.
chisen: 我必須找水管工說說淋浴器的事。
engsen: I must get onto the plumber about the shower .

chi: 跟…說（尤指要求某人做事或向其抱怨）
eng: If you are onto someone, you talk to that person, especially to ask them to do something, or to complain to them.
chisen: 爸爸又催促她做功課了。
engsen: Dad was onto her again about doing her homework .

chi: 某人加入；某事物被添加
eng: used about someone or something that is added to or joins a particular thing
chisen: 伊米爾被選為工會委員會的成員。
engsen: Imir's been voted onto the union committee .

chi: 某人加入；某事物被添加
eng: used about someone or something that is added to or joins a particular thing

engsen: I've been having problems loading this software onto my computer .

eng: someone whose job is to use and control a machine or vehicle
chisen: 電腦操作員
engsen: a computer operator

eng: an occasion or situation that makes it possible to do something that you want to do or have to do, or the possibility of doing something
chisen: 每個人都有機會發表意見。
engsen: Everyone will have an opportunity to comment .

eng: an occasion or situation that makes it possible to do something that you want to do or have to do, or the possibility of doing something

engsen: I was never given the opportunity of going to college .

eng: an occasion or situation that makes it possible to do something that you want to do or have to do, or the possibility of doing something

engsen: The exhibition is a unique opportunity to see her later work .

chi: 全然不同的，迥異的，截然相反的
eng: completely different

engsen: You'd never know they're sisters - they're completely opposite to each other in every way .

chi: 全然不同的，迥異的，截然相反的
eng: completely different

engsen: Police attempts to calm the violence had the opposite effect .

chi: 另一邊的，相反的，對面的
eng: being in a position on the other side; facing
chisen: 我哥哥和我住在城裡兩個方向相反的區。
engsen: My brother and I live on opposite sides of the city .

chi: 另一邊的，相反的，對面的
eng: being in a position on the other side; facing

engsen: The map on the opposite page shows where these birds commonly breed .

chi: 另一邊的，相反的，對面的
eng: being in a position on the other side; facing

engsen: They sat at opposite ends of the table (to/from each other) , refusing to talk .

eng: hoping or believing that good things will happen in the future
chisen: 她對贏得金牌很樂觀。
engsen: She is optimistic about her chances of winning a gold medal .

eng: the beginning or cause of something
chisen: 這是一本關於宇宙起源的書。
engsen: It's a book about the origin of the universe .

eng: the beginning or cause of something
chisen: 她不幸的童年導致她後來生活中的諸多問題。
engsen: Her unhappy childhood was the origin of her problems later in life .

eng: the beginning or cause of something

engsen: What's the origin of this saying ? (= Where did it come from?)

eng: existing since the beginning, or being the earliest form of something
chisen: 這是原先的壁爐嗎？
engsen: Is this the original fireplace ?

eng: existing since the beginning, or being the earliest form of something
chisen: 這些園林最近恢復了原先的輝煌。
engsen: The gardens have recently been restored to their original glory .

chi: 獨創的，有創意的，新穎的
eng: not the same as anything or anyone else and therefore special and interesting

engsen: She's a highly original young designer .

eng: a child whose parents are dead

engsen: The civil war is making orphans of many children .

eng: existing, happening, or done outside, rather than inside a building

engsen: an outdoor swimming pool/festival

eng: outside

engsen: Every year he takes a month off work to go hiking in the great outdoors (= in the countryside , far away from towns) .

eng: at a greater distance from the centre

engsen: the outer lane of the motorway

eng: the main shape or edge of something, without any details

engsen: She drew the outline of the boat and then coloured it in .

engsen: If you read the minutes of the meeting , they'll give you a broad outline of what was discussed .

eng: a description of the main facts about something

engsen: Some novelists start by writing an outline (= plan of the main points of the story) .

eng: to need to pay or give something to someone because they have lent money to you, or in exchange for something they have done for you
chisen: 我欠珍妮特50美元。
engsen: I owe Janet $50 .

eng: to need to pay or give something to someone because they have lent money to you, or in exchange for something they have done for you

engsen: We still owe $1,000 on our car (= we still need to pay $1,000 before we own our car) .

eng: to need to pay or give something to someone because they have lent money to you, or in exchange for something they have done for you
chisen: 你幫我搬家，我該請你喝一杯 。
engsen: I owe you a drink for helping me move .

engsen: I owe my success to my education .

eng: to have success, happiness, a job, etc. only because of what someone has given you or done for you or because of your own efforts

engsen: He owes his life to the staff at the hospital .

engsen: I owe everything (= I am very grateful) to my parents .

engsen: Do you have any proof of ownership of/for this car ?

eng: the fact that you own something

engsen: Rates of home ownership have remained relatively constant .

eng: a piece of soft, thick cloth or rubber, used to protect a part of the body, give shape to something, or clean something

engsen: a knee/shoulder pad

eng: a piece of soft, thick cloth or rubber, used to protect a part of the body, give shape to something, or clean something

engsen: Soccer players often wear shin pads to protect their legs .

eng: a person's house or apartment

engsen: a bachelor pad

a 
bucket

engsen: Fill the pail with sand .

a 
bucket

eng: a large house that is the official home of a king, queen, or other person of high social rank

engsen: Buckingham Palace is open to the public .

eng: used to describe a person's face or skin if it has less colour than usual, for example when the person is or ill or frightened, or if it has less colour than people generally have

engsen: You're looking pale - are you feeling well ?

eng: used to describe a person's face or skin if it has less colour than usual, for example when the person is or ill or frightened, or if it has less colour than people generally have
chisen: 她天生膚色白皙，頭髮烏黑。
engsen: She has a naturally pale complexion and dark hair .

eng: a thin, flat, round cake made from a mixture of flour, milk, and egg, fried on both sides
chisen: 你想吃甜的薄煎餅還是鹹的？
engsen: Do you want a sweet pancake or a savoury one ?

eng: a sudden strong feeling of fear that prevents reasonable thought and action

engsen: a state of panic

eng: a sudden strong feeling of fear that prevents reasonable thought and action

eng: a sudden strong feeling of fear that prevents reasonable thought and action
chisen: 卡梅爾很害怕考試。
engsen: Carmel was in a panic about her exam .

eng: a large number of people walking or in vehicles, all going in the same direction, usually as part of a public celebration of something

engsen: a victory parade

eng: a place or condition of great happiness where everything is exactly as you would like it to be

engsen: a tropical paradise

eng: a place or condition of great happiness where everything is exactly as you would like it to be

engsen: His idea of paradise is to spend the day lying on the beach .

eng: a place or condition of great happiness where everything is exactly as you would like it to be

engsen: This mall is a shopper's paradise .

eng: an object or collection of objects wrapped in paper, especially so that it can be sent by post
chisen: 一包食品
engsen: a food parcel

eng: an object or collection of objects wrapped in paper, especially so that it can be sent by post

engsen: The parcel was wrapped in plain brown paper .

eng: an area of land

engsen: a 60-acre parcel

engsen: She never participates in any of our discussions , does she ?

engsen: A narrow passage led directly through the house into the garden .

eng: a usually long and narrow part of a building with rooms on one or both sides, or a covered path that connects places

engsen: The bathroom's on the right at the end of the passage .

eng: a short piece of writing or music that is part of a larger piece of work

engsen: Several passages from the book were printed in a national newspaper before it was published .

eng: travel, especially as a way of escape

engsen: The gunman demanded a plane and safe passage to an unspecified destination .

eng: an act of moving through somewhere
chisen: 許多流星在穿越大氣層時會分解。
engsen: Many meteors disintegrate during their passage through the atmosphere .

eng: an act of moving through somewhere

engsen: The government prohibits the passage of foreign troops and planes across its territory .

eng: the process of time going past

engsen: He again urged passage of a constitutional amendment outlawing abortion .

eng: a very powerful feeling, for example of sexual attraction, love, hate, anger, or other emotion

engsen: Football arouses a good deal of passion among its fans .

eng: a very powerful feeling, for example of sexual attraction, love, hate, anger, or other emotion

engsen: At school , his early interest in music developed into an abiding passion .

eng: a very powerful feeling, for example of sexual attraction, love, hate, anger, or other emotion
chisen: 政治學和哲學是他畢生熱愛的學科。
engsen: Politics and philosophy were his lifelong passions .

eng: an official document containing personal information and usually a photograph that allows a person to travel to foreign countries and to prove who they are
chisen: 許多難民到達邊境時身上沒有護照。
engsen: Many refugees have arrived at the border without passports .

eng: an official document containing personal information and usually a photograph that allows a person to travel to foreign countries and to prove who they are
chisen: 他是個德國人，持瑞士護照旅行。
engsen: He was a German , travelling on a Swiss passport .

eng: an official document containing personal information and usually a photograph that allows a person to travel to foreign countries and to prove who they are
chisen: 護照檢查
engsen: passport control (= the examining of travellers' passports)

eng: a secret word or combination of letters or numbers, used for communicating with another person or with a computer to prove who you are

engsen: I can't let you in unless you give the password .

eng: a secret word or combination of letters or numbers, used for communicating with another person or with a computer to prove who you are
chisen: 不輸入密碼你是無法進入電腦系統的。
engsen: You can't gain access to the computer system without entering your password .

eng: the ability to wait, or to continue doing something despite difficulties, or to suffer without complaining or becoming annoyed
chisen: 和孩子相處需要有這麼大的耐心才行。
engsen: You have to have such a lot of patience when you're dealing with kids .

eng: the ability to wait, or to continue doing something despite difficulties, or to suffer without complaining or becoming annoyed
chisen: 最後我失去了耐性，對她大吼大叫起來。
engsen: In the end I lost my patience and shouted at her .

eng: the ability to wait, or to continue doing something despite difficulties, or to suffer without complaining or becoming annoyed
chisen: 他是個好老師，但對較遲鈍的學生沒多大耐心。
engsen: He's a good teacher , but he doesn't have much patience with the slower pupils .

eng: a short period in which something such as a sound or an activity is stopped before starting again
chisen: 在將鋼琴搬過去放好之前，活動將暫停一會兒。
engsen: There will be a brief pause in the proceedings while the piano is moved into place .

eng: a short period in which something such as a sound or an activity is stopped before starting again
chisen: 在長得令人尷尬的停頓過後，有人問了個問題。
engsen: After a long , awkward pause , someone finally asked a question .

eng: a short period in which something such as a sound or an activity is stopped before starting again
chisen: 她一連說了45分鐘，連停都沒停一下。
engsen: She spoke for three quarters of an hour without so much as a pause .

eng: to cover an area of ground with a hard, flat surface of pieces of stone, concrete, or bricks
chisen: 靠近海灘的這片區域是用拼花磚鋪就的。
engsen: The area near the beach is paved with bricks set in patterns .

eng: a path with a hard surface on one or both sides of a road, that people walk on
chisen: 沿著人行道走，羅茜，乖孩子。
engsen: Keep to the pavement , Rosie , there's a good girl .

eng: the foot of an animal that has claws or nails, such as a cat, dog, or bear
chisen: 我在廚房裡發現了爪印。
engsen: I found paw prints in the kitchen .

eng: a fixed amount of money agreed every year as pay for an employee, usually paid directly into his or her bank account every month
chisen: 40000英鎊的年薪
engsen: an annual salary of £40,000

eng: a fixed amount of money agreed every year as pay for an employee, usually paid directly into his or her bank account every month

engsen: His net monthly salary is €2,500 .

eng: a fixed amount of money agreed every year as pay for an employee, usually paid directly into his or her bank account every month
chisen: 她目前的工作薪水相當豐厚。
engsen: She's on quite a good/decent salary in her present job .

chi: （尤指支付給體力勞動者並通常按週計算的）工資，工錢，報酬
eng: a particular amount of money that is paid, usually every week, to an employee, especially one who does work that needs physical skills or strength, rather than a job needing a college education
chisen: 非常低／高的工資
engsen: a very low/high wage

eng: to make a substance flow from a container, especially into another container, by raising just one side of the container that the substance is in

engsen: Would you like me to pour you some more wine ?

eng: to (cause to) flow quickly and in large amounts

engsen: The bus was pouring out thick black exhaust fumes .

eng: to (cause to) flow quickly and in large amounts

engsen: The government has been pouring money into inefficient state-owned industries , and the country can no longer afford it .

eng: to (cause to) flow quickly and in large amounts

engsen: I felt a sharp pain and looked down to see blood pouring from my leg .

eng: the condition of being extremely poor

engsen: He emigrated to Australia to escape the grinding (= very great) poverty of his birthplace .

engsen: Helping to alleviate poverty in developing countries also helps to reduce environmental destruction .

eng: a loose, dry substance that consists of extremely small pieces, usually made by breaking something up and crushing it

engsen: You'll get more flavour from the spices if you grind them into a powder .

eng: a loose, dry substance that consists of extremely small pieces, usually made by breaking something up and crushing it

eng: relating to experience, real situations, or actions rather than ideas or imagination

engsen: Qualifications are important but practical experience is always a plus .

engsen: The service offers young people practical advice on finding a job .

engsen: What's the use of theoretical knowledge that has no practical application ?

eng: suitable for the situation in which something is used

engsen: Heavy boots aren't very practical for running .

engsen: She has lots of interesting ideas , but they're not very practical .

chi: 實用的，有效的；能解決問題的

engsen: We need someone practical who can cope with a crisis .

engsen: It's simply not practical to divide the work between so many people .

eng: the words that someone says or thinks when they are praying

engsen: a prayer of thanks

eng: the words that someone says or thinks when they are praying

eng: of great value because of being rare, expensive, or important

engsen: a precious gift

eng: of great value because of being rare, expensive, or important

engsen: He's so precious about his work that he never gets anything done .

eng: behaving in a very formal and unnatural way by giving too much attention to details that are not important and trying too hard to be perfect

engsen: Don't you hate the precious way she speaks , pronouncing each single consonant so precisely .

engsen: You and your precious car - it's all you're interested in !

eng: the things that you do or the time that you spend preparing for something

engsen: The teacher didn't seem to have done much preparation for the class .

eng: the things that you do or the time that you spend preparing for something

engsen: Yasmin assisted in the preparation of this article .

eng: a mixture of substances, often for use as a medicine

eng: the force you produce when you press something

eng: the force you produce when you press something

engsen: You can stop bleeding by applying pressure close to the injured area .

eng: the act of trying to make someone else do something by arguing, persuading, etc.

eng: to behave as if something is true when you know that it is not, especially in order to deceive people or as a game

engsen: Father O'Dooley was ordained a priest in 1949 .

eng: a series of actions that you take in order to achieve a result

engsen: the peace process

eng: a place, especially in Great Britain or Ireland, where alcoholic drinks can be bought and drunk and where food is often available

engsen: a ticket punch

engsen: pure English honey

eng: to follow someone or something, usually to try to catch him, her, or it

engsen: We need to decide soon what marketing strategy we should pursue for these new products .

eng: If you pursue a plan, activity, or situation, you try to do it or achieve it, usually over a long period of time.
chisen: 麥克•埃文斯準備離開這家公司，去自己創業。
engsen: Michael Evans is leaving the company to pursue his own business interests .

eng: an angry disagreement between two or more people or groups
chisen: 他們三年前因為錢的問題有過一次激烈的爭吵，從此以後就互不理睬了。
engsen: They had a bitter quarrel about/over some money three years ago and they haven't spoken to each other since .

eng: an angry disagreement between two or more people or groups
chisen: 我們沒有理由對貴國的人民感到不滿。
engsen: We have no quarrel with the people of your country (= we have no reason to disagree with or dislike them) .

eng: an angry disagreement between two or more people or groups
chisen: 他們似乎在爭吵後言歸於好了。
engsen: They seem to have patched up their quarrel (= finished their disagreement and started to be friendly) .

eng: strange, unusual, or not expected
chisen: 多麼奇怪的事啊！
engsen: What a queer thing to say !

eng: strange, unusual, or not expected
chisen: 我感覺很不舒服，可以坐下嗎？
engsen: I'm feeling rather queer (= ill) , may I sit down ?

eng: to repeat the words that someone else has said or written
chisen: 他總是引用《聖經》上的話。
engsen: He's always quoting from the Bible .

eng: to repeat the words that someone else has said or written
chisen: 援引那位官員的話說：「如果他們能變通，我們也能變通。」
engsen: "If they're flexible , we're flexible" , the official was quoted as saying .

eng: to repeat the words that someone else has said or written
chisen: 用她女兒的話來說，她工作起來「就像沒有明天似的」。
engsen: She worked , to quote her daughter , "as if there were no tomorrow" .

eng: to give a price, especially one that will be charged for doing a piece of work
chisen: 對露臺部分，建築師開價九萬英鎊。
engsen: The architect has quoted £90,000 to build a patio .

chi: 種族的；種族間的；種族關係的
eng: happening between people of different races
chisen: 他夢想在一個社會中各種族能和諧共處。
engsen: He had a vision of a society living in racial harmony .

eng: a system that uses radio waves to find the position of objects that cannot be seen
chisen: 該船的雷達（螢幕）顯示這一海域有其他船隻。
engsen: Other vessels in the area show up on the ship's radar (screen) .

eng: a torn piece of old cloth
chisen: 我把這些舊布留下來擦汽車用。
engsen: I keep these rags for cleaning the car .

chi: 質量低劣的報紙（或雜誌）；低俗小報；粗製濫造的雜誌
eng: a newspaper or magazine that is considered to be of bad quality
chisen: 他為一家地方小報拍了照片。
engsen: He had his picture taken for some local rag .

eng: a position in an organization, such as the army, showing the importance of the person having it
chisen: 他剛被提升為上尉。
engsen: He has just been promoted to the rank of captain .

eng: a position in an organization, such as the army, showing the importance of the person having it
chisen: 進入內閣的部長比其他部長的薪金高。
engsen: Ministers of cabinet rank receive a higher salary than other ministers .

eng: a position in an organization, such as the army, showing the importance of the person having it
chisen: 職位級別高的好處之一就是收入高。
engsen: Having a large income is one of the advantages of rank (= high position) .

eng: a row, especially of people or things standing side by side
chisen: 前排的防暴隊員舉起了盾牌。
engsen: The front rank of the riot squad raised their shields .

eng: a row, especially of people or things standing side by side
chisen: 數英里範圍內，映入眼簾的只有一排排密密叢叢的冷杉樹。
engsen: We could see nothing for miles but serried ranks (= many close rows) of fir trees .

eng: the speed at which something happens or changes, or the amount or number of times it happens or changes in a particular period
chisen: 儘管病情正在好轉，但她康復的速度仍很慢。
engsen: Although she's recovering from her illness , her rate of progress is quite slow .

eng: the speed at which something happens or changes, or the amount or number of times it happens or changes in a particular period
chisen: 我告訴我的助手們按照他們自己的進度工作。
engsen: I told my assistants to work at their own rate .

eng: the speed at which something happens or changes, or the amount or number of times it happens or changes in a particular period
chisen: 計程車飛速奔馳。
engsen: The taxi was going at a tremendous rate .

eng: an amount or level of payment
chisen: 開工前，我們和油漆工談好了薪酬。
engsen: We agreed a rate with the painter before he started work .

eng: an amount or level of payment
chisen: 這種工作一般酬金是多少？
engsen: What's the going (= standard) rate for this type of work ?

eng: an amount or level of payment
chisen: 你怎樣還抵押貸款，是定額償付還是不定額償付？
engsen: Do you pay your mortgage on a fixed or variable rate (= of interest) ?

chi: 原料未經加工的，自然狀態的
eng: (of materials) in a natural state, without having been through any chemical or industrial process
chisen: 石油是一種重要的原料，可以加工成包括塑膠在內的許多種産品。
engsen: Oil is an important raw material that can be processed into many different products , including plastics .

chi: 原料未經加工的，自然狀態的
eng: (of materials) in a natural state, without having been through any chemical or industrial process
chisen: 他們斷言，下水道的污水未經處理就被直接排入了大海。
engsen: They claimed that raw sewage was being pumped into the sea .

chi: （肌肉）擦掉表皮而外露的；（傷口）露肉而刺痛的；創痛的
eng: sore or painful because of being rubbed or damaged
chisen: 鞋把她的一個腳後跟磨破了。
engsen: The shoe had rubbed a raw place on her heel .

eng: used to describe weather that is very cold
chisen: 一個寒冷的早晨
engsen: a raw morning

eng: used to describe weather that is very cold
chisen: 刺骨的寒風
engsen: a raw wind

eng: used to describe weather that is very cold
chisen: 那個晚上寒冷刺骨。
engsen: The evening was cold and raw .

chi: 光線，光束；（熱能等的）輻射線
eng: a narrow beam of light, heat, etc. travelling in a straight line from its place of origin
chisen: 一縷陽光透過雲隙照射下來。
engsen: A ray of sunshine shone through a gap in the clouds .

chi: 光線，光束；（熱能等的）輻射線
eng: a narrow beam of light, heat, etc. travelling in a straight line from its place of origin
chisen: 光線從空氣射入水中會發生折射。
engsen: Light rays bend as they pass from air to water .

chi: 一線，少量的（積極情感或希望等）
eng: a small amount of a feeling that makes you feel happier or more full of hope
chisen: 失蹤的孩子尚有一絲被活著找到的希望。
engsen: There's still a ray of hope that the missing child will be found alive .

chi: （尤指刮鬍鬚或腳毛的）剃刀，刮鬍刀，剃鬚刀
eng: a small device with a sharp blade for removing hair, especially from the face or legs
chisen: 你用的是電動刮鬚刀還是那種要裝刀片的刮鬍刀？
engsen: Do you use an electric razor or the kind that you have to put a razor blade in ?

eng: to act in a particular way as a direct result of something else
chisen: 她打他並辱罵他，但他不予回應。
engsen: She slapped him and called him names , but he didn't react .

eng: to act in a particular way as a direct result of something else
chisen: 有人說審判不公正，法官對此很憤怒。
engsen: The judge reacted angrily to the suggestion that it hadn't been a fair trial .

eng: to act in a particular way as a direct result of something else
chisen: 很多人對青黴素（嚴重）過敏。
engsen: Many people react (badly) to (= are made ill by) penicillin .

eng: behaviour, a feeling or an action that is a direct result of something else
chisen: 我喜歡觀察人們在聽到我說出我是誰時的反應。
engsen: I love to watch people's reactions when I say who I am .

eng: behaviour, a feeling or an action that is a direct result of something else
chisen: 人們對政府的增稅計劃迅速作出了反應／政府的增稅計劃引起了廣泛的反應／政府的增稅計劃遭到了反對。
engsen: There has been an immediate/widespread/hostile reaction against the government's proposed tax increases .

eng: behaviour, a feeling or an action that is a direct result of something else
chisen: 到目前為止，人們對該計劃一直持反對態度／表示支持／反應不一。
engsen: Reactions to the proposal so far have been adverse/favourable/mixed .

chi: （對食物、藥物等的）不良反應，過敏
eng: an unpleasant effect resulting from eating particular things or taking particular drugs
chisen: 有些人吃貝類會有過敏反應。
engsen: Some people have an allergic reaction to shellfish .

eng: an occasion when two or more substances react with and change each other
chisen: 化學反應
engsen: a chemical reaction

eng: the belief or principle that there should be no social or political change, and the attempt to stop such change from happening
chisen: 我們一定不能讓保守主義成為前進道路上的絆腳石。
engsen: We must not allow reaction to stand in the way of progress .

chi: 合情理的；講道理的；公平的
eng: based on or using good judgment and therefore fair and practical
chisen: 如果你把發生的事情說給他聽，我相信他肯定會理解的——他是個通情達理的人。
engsen: If you tell him what happened , I'm sure he'll understand - he's a reasonable man .

chi: 合情理的；講道理的；公平的
eng: based on or using good judgment and therefore fair and practical
chisen: 他沒有被判罪，因為陪審團認定指控他犯罪的證據不足。
engsen: He went free because the jury decided there was a reasonable doubt about his guilt .

eng: a piece of paper that proves that money, goods, or information have been received
chisen: 買甚麽東西都一定記著要發票。
engsen: Make sure you are given a receipt for everything you buy .

eng: the act or state of receiving money or goods
chisen: 款到即發貨。
engsen: Goods will be delivered on receipt of payment (= after the money is received) .

eng: the act or state of receiving money or goods
chisen: 你領失業救濟金已經兩個月了。
engsen: You have been in receipt of unemployment benefit for two months .

eng: the part of a phone in two parts that you hold to your ear and mouth
chisen: 她拿起電話撥了他的號碼。
engsen: She picked up the receiver and dialled his number .

eng: a person who officially deals with the business matters of companies who cannot pay their debts
chisen: 公司破産了，由破産管理人接管。
engsen: The company went bankrupt and was put into the hands of the receivers .

eng: to know someone or something because you have seen or heard him or her or experienced it before
chisen: 我20年沒見她了，但我還是一眼就認出了她。
engsen: I hadn't seen her for 20 years , but I recognized her immediately .

eng: to know someone or something because you have seen or heard him or her or experienced it before
chisen: 「你聽出這首歌來了嗎？」
engsen: Do you recognize this song ?

eng: to know someone or something because you have seen or heard him or her or experienced it before
chisen: 醫生受過訓練可以辨識出不同疾病的症狀。
engsen: Doctors are trained to recognize the symptoms of different diseases .

eng: to accept that something is legal, true, or important
chisen: 國際社會拒絕承認這個新獨立的國家。
engsen: The international community has refused to recognize (= officially accept the existence of) the newly independent nation state .

eng: to accept that something is legal, true, or important
chisen: 他接受了這個悲哀的事實：他將無兒無女、孤苦伶仃地度過殘生。
engsen: He sadly recognized (that) he would die childless .

eng: to accept that something is legal, true, or important
chisen: 你必須認識到我們現在面臨的問題有多嚴重。
engsen: You must recognize the seriousness of the problems we are facing .

chi: （在疾病或受傷之後）完全恢復健康
eng: to become completely well again after an illness or injury
chisen: 她心臟動手術後很長時間身體才復原。
engsen: It took her a long time to recover from/after her heart operation .

chi: （在疾病或受傷之後）完全恢復健康
eng: to become completely well again after an illness or injury
chisen: 他再也沒有從喪妻之痛中真正恢復過來。
engsen: He never really recovered from the shock of his wife dying .

eng: to become or to make something become smaller in size, amount, degree, importance, etc.
chisen: 核武器真的可以減小戰爭爆發的危險嗎？
engsen: Do nuclear weapons really reduce the risk of war ?

eng: to become or to make something become smaller in size, amount, degree, importance, etc.
chisen: 當飛臨機場時，飛機減慢了速度。
engsen: The plane reduced speed as it approached the airport .

eng: to become or to make something become smaller in size, amount, degree, importance, etc.
chisen: 我停止吃糖時體重就會下降。
engsen: My weight reduces when I stop eating sugar .

eng: relating to or coming from a particular part of a country
chisen: 地區口音／方言／地方報紙
engsen: a regional accent/dialect/newspaper

eng: a feeling of sadness about something sad or wrong or about a mistake that you have made, and a wish that it could have been different and better
chisen: 我16歲就輟學了，但是我的人生很成功，我沒有甚麽可遺憾的。
engsen: I left school at 16 , but I've had a great life and I have no regrets .

eng: a feeling of sadness about something sad or wrong or about a mistake that you have made, and a wish that it could have been different and better
chisen: 被裁減的員工人數衆多，對此經理深表遺憾。
engsen: The manager expressed deep regret at/for the number of staff reductions .

eng: a feeling of sadness about something sad or wrong or about a mistake that you have made, and a wish that it could have been different and better
chisen: 我們覺得，明年可能沒法到你們家去做客了，真是遺憾。
engsen: We think , much to our regret (= and we are very sorry about this) , that we will not be able to visit you next year .

eng: to find or show the connection between two or more things
chisen: 我們需要解釋為什麼這些問題很重要並且和他們的日常生活相關。
engsen: We need to explain why these issues are important and relate them to everyday life .

eng: to find or show the connection between two or more things
chisen: 考古學家希望把這些發現與西元十世紀維京人的到來聯繫起來。
engsen: Archaeologists hope to relate the discovery with the arrival of Vikings in the area in the tenth century .

eng: to find or show the connection between two or more things
chisen: 將壓力、體積與溫度相連的方程式
engsen: equations that relate variables of pressure , volume , and temperature

eng: to tell a story or describe a series of events
chisen: 她對警方講述了上個星期發生的事情。
engsen: She related the events of the previous week to the police .

eng: to tell a story or describe a series of events
chisen: 她提到有雇員找到她要求休假。
engsen: She related that she had been approached by an employee asking for time off .

eng: to tell a story or describe a series of events
chisen: 他講述了他在23歲時被關押在戰俘營中的經歷。
engsen: He relates how at the age of 23 he was interned in a prison camp .

eng: to be able to understand a situation or someone's feelings because you have experienced something similar yourself
chisen: 我經常很早就醒了，我相信許多50歲以上的讀者會有共鳴。
engsen: I often wake very early - I'm sure most readers over 50 can relate .

chi: （使）放鬆，（使）輕鬆；（使身體部位）鬆弛，放鬆
eng: to (cause someone to) become less active and more calm and happy, or to (cause a part of the body to) become less stiff
chisen: 下班後，她喝杯茶讀著報紙放鬆放鬆。
engsen: After work she relaxed with a cup of tea and the newspaper .

chi: （使）放鬆，（使）輕鬆；（使身體部位）鬆弛，放鬆
eng: to (cause someone to) become less active and more calm and happy, or to (cause a part of the body to) become less stiff
chisen: 好好按摩一下會使你疲勞的肌肉放鬆。
engsen: A good massage will relax your tired muscles .

chi: （使）放鬆，（使）輕鬆；（使身體部位）鬆弛，放鬆
eng: to (cause someone to) become less active and more calm and happy, or to (cause a part of the body to) become less stiff
chisen: 他緊抓著我手臂的手不再那麽用力了。
engsen: He relaxed his grip on my arm (= he began to hold it less tightly) .

eng: to make a rule or control less severe
chisen: 警方放鬆了對機場採取的安全措施兩週後就發生了一起炸彈襲擊事件。
engsen: Two weeks after the police relaxed security at the airports , there was a bomb attack .

eng: to give freedom or free movement to someone or something
chisen: 他被判五年徒刑，但是服刑兩年後就被釋放出獄了。
engsen: He was released from prison after serving two years of a five-year sentence .

eng: to give freedom or free movement to someone or something
chisen: 她因為在商店行竊而被捕，但是在交納保釋金後就被釋放了。
engsen: She was arrested for shoplifting but was released on bail (= after paying a sum of money to the court) .

eng: to give freedom or free movement to someone or something
chisen: 手術使他擺脫了多年的病痛。
engsen: The surgery released him from years of pain .

eng: to allow something to be shown in public or to be available for use
chisen: 警方公佈了他們想要問訊的一名男子的照片。
engsen: Police have released a picture of the man they want to question .

eng: to allow something to be shown in public or to be available for use
chisen: 市長發表了一份聲明，解釋他辭職的原因。
engsen: The mayor has released a statement explaining the reasons for his resignation .

chi: 可信賴的；可靠的；真實可信的
eng: Someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or believed because he, she, or it works or behaves well in the way you expect.
chisen: 你的錶準嗎？
engsen: Is your watch reliable ?

chi: 可信賴的；可靠的；真實可信的
eng: Someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or believed because he, she, or it works or behaves well in the way you expect.
chisen: 吉迪恩爲人很可靠——他說到做到。
engsen: Gideon is very reliable - if he says he'll do something , he'll do it .

chi: （不快過後的）寬慰，寬心，輕鬆，解脫
eng: a feeling of happiness that something unpleasant has not happened or has ended
chisen: 聽到瑪爾塔安然無恙被找到，真是如釋重負。
engsen: It was such a relief to hear that Marta was found safe and well .

chi: （不快過後的）寬慰，寬心，輕鬆，解脫
eng: a feeling of happiness that something unpleasant has not happened or has ended
chisen: 考試過後，我感到輕鬆無比。
engsen: After the exam , I felt an incredible sense of relief .

chi: （不快過後的）寬慰，寬心，輕鬆，解脫
eng: a feeling of happiness that something unpleasant has not happened or has ended
chisen: 尋找／找到／提供避暑之地／暖和的地方／止痛的方法／清靜之地
engsen: to seek/find/provide relief from the heat/cold/pain/noise

eng: food, money, or services that provide help for people in need
chisen: 國際救援行動
engsen: an international relief operation

eng: food, money, or services that provide help for people in need
chisen: 歌星們已經籌集了數百萬英鎊的善款救濟非洲饑民。
engsen: Musicians have raised millions of dollars for famine relief in Africa .

eng: a method of raising shapes above a flat surface so that they appear to stand out slightly from it
chisen: 硬幣上面有浮雕圖案。
engsen: Coins have pictures on them in relief .

eng: the belief in and worship of a god or gods, or any such system of belief and worship
chisen: 基督教
engsen: the Christian religion

chi: 停留，留下；保持不變，仍然是
eng: to stay in the same place or in the same condition
chisen: 醫生囑咐他要繼續臥床幾天。
engsen: The doctor ordered him to remain in bed for a few days .

chi: 停留，留下；保持不變，仍然是
eng: to stay in the same place or in the same condition
chisen: 大多數評論員預計基本稅率會保持在25%。
engsen: Most commentators expect the basic rate of tax to remain at 25 percent .

chi: 停留，留下；保持不變，仍然是
eng: to stay in the same place or in the same condition
chisen: 還有很多事情要去做。
engsen: A great many things remain to be done (= have not yet been done) .

eng: to make someone think of something they have forgotten or might have forgotten
chisen: 你能否提醒一下保羅週六晚宴的事？
engsen: Could you remind Paul about dinner on Saturday ?

eng: to make someone think of something they have forgotten or might have forgotten
chisen: 請提醒我寄這封信。
engsen: Please remind me to post this letter .

eng: to make someone think of something they have forgotten or might have forgotten
chisen: 我給簡打電話提醒她會議已經取消了。
engsen: I called Jane and reminded her (that) the conference had been cancelled .

chi: 遠的；遙遠的；久遠的；關係疏遠的
eng: far away in distance or time, or not closely related
chisen: 這件事發生在很久很久以前了，所以沒有人再為此擔心。
engsen: It happened in the remote past , so no one worries about it any more .

chi: 遠的；遙遠的；久遠的；關係疏遠的
eng: far away in distance or time, or not closely related
chisen: 這是一場遠在他們家鄉千里之外的衝突，和他們每天遇到的問題也毫不沾邊，他們對其不怎麽感興趣。
engsen: They take little interest in a conflict far from their homes and remote from their everyday problems .

chi: 絕少的；微小的；微乎其微的
eng: slight
chisen: 微乎其微的可能性
engsen: a remote possibility

chi: 絕少的；微小的；微乎其微的
eng: slight
chisen: 火星人訪問地球的可能性微乎其微。
engsen: The chances of a visit by Martians to Earth are remote .

chi: 不友好的；冷漠的；孤高的
eng: not very friendly or showing little interest in other people
chisen: 她的舉止孤高冷漠。
engsen: Her manner was remote and cool .

chi: 移開；拿開；去掉；除去；調動
eng: to take something or someone away from somewhere, or off something
chisen: 這些人來清除後院的垃圾。
engsen: The men came to remove the rubbish from the backyard .

chi: 移開；拿開；去掉；除去；調動
eng: to take something or someone away from somewhere, or off something
chisen: 這種洗滌劑就連以前的頑漬也能除去。
engsen: This detergent will remove even old stains .

chi: 移開；拿開；去掉；除去；調動
eng: to take something or someone away from somewhere, or off something
chisen: 天氣太熱了，他解下領帶，脫掉外套。
engsen: It got so hot that he removed his tie and jacket .

chi: 將…免職；開除；解除（某人的職務）
eng: to force someone to leave an important job or a position of power because they have behaved badly or not in a way you approve of
chisen: 公司股東已經投票決定罷免執行董事會。
engsen: The company's shareholders have voted to remove the executive board .

chi: 將…免職；開除；解除（某人的職務）
eng: to force someone to leave an important job or a position of power because they have behaved badly or not in a way you approve of
chisen: 幾個反對團體在極力爭取把總統趕下臺。
engsen: Several opposition groups are fighting to remove the president from power .

chi: 將…免職；開除；解除（某人的職務）
eng: to force someone to leave an important job or a position of power because they have behaved badly or not in a way you approve of
chisen: 她已經被免去了董事職位。
engsen: She has been removed from her post/position as director .

chi: 給…展期，延長…的期限；更新，更換
eng: to increase the life of or replace something old
chisen: 我每年都將體育俱樂部會員資格續期。
engsen: Every year I renew my membership of the sports club .

chi: 給…展期，延長…的期限；更新，更換
eng: to increase the life of or replace something old
chisen: 我忘了辦理季票續期了。
engsen: I forgot to renew my season ticket .

chi: 給…展期，延長…的期限；更新，更換
eng: to increase the life of or replace something old
chisen: 我要用這塊布料做新的椅子罩來換掉舊的。
engsen: I'll use this material to renew the chair covers .

eng: to begin doing something again
chisen: 綁架者又發出威脅了。
engsen: The kidnappers renewed their threats .

eng: to begin doing something again
chisen: 她再次企圖逃跑。
engsen: She renewed her efforts to escape .

eng: a fixed amount of money that you pay regularly for the use of a room, house, car, television, etc. that someone else owns
chisen: 我的房租比其他房客高，因為我的房間要大些。
engsen: I pay a higher rent/more rent than the other tenants because my room is bigger .

eng: a fixed amount of money that you pay regularly for the use of a room, house, car, television, etc. that someone else owns
chisen: 這裡的房租高／低得出奇。
engsen: Rents here are ridiculously high/low .

eng: a large hole torn in a piece of material
chisen: 他的降落傘上裂了個大口子。
engsen: There was a large rent in his parachute .

eng: to put something that is damaged, broken, or not working correctly, back into good condition or make it work again
chisen: 修路（面）
engsen: to repair (the surface of) the road

eng: to put something that is damaged, broken, or not working correctly, back into good condition or make it work again
chisen: 暴風雨後修理房頂
engsen: to repair a roof after a storm

eng: to put something that is damaged, broken, or not working correctly, back into good condition or make it work again
chisen: 修車廠的人說這輛車太舊，不值得修了。
engsen: The garage said the car was so old it wasn't worth repairing .

eng: to take the place of something, or to put something or someone in the place of something or someone else
chisen: 這間工廠用機器人取代了大多數工人。
engsen: The factory replaced most of its workers with robots .

eng: to take the place of something, or to put something or someone in the place of something or someone else
chisen: 旅遊業取代了農業成為這個國家的主要産業。
engsen: Tourism has replaced agriculture as the nation's main industry .

eng: to put something back where it was before
chisen: 圖書管理員把書一本不差地放回了原處。
engsen: The librarian replaced the books correctly on the shelves .

eng: the process of replacing something with something else
chisen: 更換現有的電腦設備
engsen: the replacement of existing computer equipment

chi: 作為…的代表（或代理人）；作為…的代言人
eng: to speak, act, or be present officially for another person or people
chisen: 他們選了一位著名律師為他們出庭辯護。
engsen: They chose a famous barrister to represent them in court .

chi: 作為…的代表（或代理人）；作為…的代言人
eng: to speak, act, or be present officially for another person or people
chisen: 代表教師的工會幹事今天與政府官員會談。
engsen: Union officials representing the teachers met the government today .

chi: 作為…的代表（或代理人）；作為…的代言人
eng: to speak, act, or be present officially for another person or people
chisen: 我請我丈夫代表我參加葬禮。
engsen: I sent my husband to represent me at the funeral .

eng: to show or describe something or someone
chisen: 這座雕像展現的是聖喬治斬龍的故事。
engsen: The statue represents St . George killing the dragon .

eng: to show or describe something or someone
chisen: 這份新的報告介紹了我們這裡的學校現狀。
engsen: This new report represents the current situation in our schools .

eng: to show or describe something or someone
chisen: 他自稱是個專家，可是他一竅不通。
engsen: He represents himself as an expert , but he knows nothing .

eng: to be the result of something, or to be something
chisen: 這本書是十年思考和研究的結晶。
engsen: This book represents ten years of thought and research .

eng: to be the result of something, or to be something
chisen: 新的報價比上一次報價高出10%。
engsen: The new offer represented an increase of 10 percent on the previous one .

eng: someone who speaks or does something officially for another person or group of people
chisen: 這間公司在每個大城市都設有銷售代表。
engsen: The firm has representatives in every major city .

chi: （通常指由選舉産生的人民代表和總統治理的）共和國，共和政體
eng: a country without a king or queen, usually governed by elected representatives of the people and a president
chisen: 中華人民共和國
engsen: the People's Republic of China

eng: the act of politely or officially asking for something
chisen: 數以百計的人要求他們提供更多的資訊。
engsen: They received hundreds of requests for more information .

eng: the act of politely or officially asking for something
chisen: 老闆拒絕了我們早下班的請求。
engsen: The boss refused our request to leave work early .

eng: the act of politely or officially asking for something
chisen: 這一條款是在卡洛斯的要求下添加到合同中的。
engsen: The clause was added to the contract at Carlos's request (= because Carlos asked for this) .

chi: 把…專門留給；把…留作；保留
eng: to keep something for a particular purpose or time
chisen: 我把週一的時間留出來專門清理辦公桌和回覆信件。
engsen: I reserve Mondays for tidying my desk and answering letters .

chi: 把…專門留給；把…留作；保留
eng: to keep something for a particular purpose or time
chisen: 這些座位是專留給老人和抱小孩的婦女的。
engsen: These seats are reserved for the elderly and women with babies .

chi: 把…專門留給；把…留作；保留
eng: to keep something for a particular purpose or time
chisen: 在我們得到更多的資訊之前，我暫不對此事發表意見。
engsen: I reserve judgment on this issue (= I won't give an opinion on it now) until we have more information .

eng: to fight against something or someone that is attacking you
chisen: （面對敵人的進攻）士兵們抵抗了兩天。
engsen: The soldiers resisted (the enemy attacks) for two days .

eng: a useful or valuable possession or quality of a country, organization, or person
chisen: 這個國家最大的資源就是勞動者的奉獻精神。
engsen: The country's greatest resource is the dedication of its workers .

eng: a useful or valuable possession or quality of a country, organization, or person
chisen: 英國的礦產資源包括煤炭和天然氣。
engsen: Britain's mineral resources include coal and gas deposits .

chi: 回答，作答；回應，作出反應
eng: to say or do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done
chisen: 每一個問題他的回答都是「我不知道」。
engsen: To every question , he responded "I don't know."

chi: 回答，作答；回應，作出反應
eng: to say or do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done
chisen: 我問她幾點了，但是她沒理我。
engsen: I asked her what the time was , but she didn't respond .

chi: 回答，作答；回應，作出反應
eng: to say or do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done
chisen: 他的反應是大步走出房間，狠狠甩上了門。
engsen: He responded by marching off and slamming the door behind him .

eng: an answer or reaction
chisen: 人們對我們廣告的反應令人失望。
engsen: Responses to our advertisement have been disappointing .

eng: an answer or reaction
chisen: 她的提議得到熱烈的回應。
engsen: Her proposals met with an enthusiastic response .

eng: an answer or reaction
chisen: 我盯著她的臉看，想知道她有何反應，但是她只是面無表情地盯著我。
engsen: I looked in her face for some response , but she just stared at me blankly .

eng: something that it is your job or duty to deal with
chisen: 她的職責就是保證工程如期完工。
engsen: It's her responsibility to ensure the project finishes on time .

eng: something that it is your job or duty to deal with
chisen: 身為護士，她對自己的工作極爲認真。
engsen: She takes her responsibilities as a nurse very seriously .

chi: 對（尤指壞事）負責任；應對…承擔責任
eng: blame for something that has happened
chisen: 恐怖分子聲稱他們對昨天的炸彈襲擊事件負責。
engsen: Terrorists have claimed responsibility for (= stated that they caused) yesterday's bomb attack .

chi: 對（尤指壞事）負責任；應對…承擔責任
eng: blame for something that has happened
chisen: 部長表示對這場災難負全責並引咎辭職。
engsen: The minister took/accepted full responsibility for (= admitted that he was to blame for) the disaster and resigned .

chi: 有鑑別能力；明辨是非的能力；負責可靠
eng: good judgment and the ability to act correctly and make decisions on your own
chisen: 他沒有絲毫責任心。
engsen: He has no sense of responsibility .

chi: 有鑑別能力；明辨是非的能力；負責可靠
eng: good judgment and the ability to act correctly and make decisions on your own
chisen: 這個職位責任重大。
engsen: The job carries a lot of responsibility (= it involves making important decisions) .

eng: to limit the movements or actions of someone, or to limit something and reduce its size or prevent it from increasing
chisen: 限制酒類銷售的措施
engsen: measures to restrict the sale of alcohol

eng: to limit the movements or actions of someone, or to limit something and reduce its size or prevent it from increasing
chisen: 政府已經限制出入境自由了。
engsen: The government has restricted freedom of movement into and out of the country .

eng: to limit the movements or actions of someone, or to limit something and reduce its size or prevent it from increasing
chisen: 家裡有很小的孩子確實會妨礙你的社交生活。
engsen: Having small children really restricts your social life .

eng: to make known or show something that is surprising or that was previously secret
chisen: 他因為向俄國人洩密而被監禁。
engsen: He was jailed for revealing secrets to the Russians .

eng: to make known or show something that is surprising or that was previously secret
chisen: 她的自傳透露她並非像大家所想像的那樣富有。
engsen: Her biography revealed that she was not as rich as everyone thought .

eng: to make known or show something that is surprising or that was previously secret
chisen: 他就是不說他把她的巧克力蛋藏在哪裡了。
engsen: He would not reveal where he had hidden her chocolate eggs .

chi: （捆紮或裝飾用的）帶子，絲帶，緞帶
eng: a long, narrow strip of material used to tie things together or as a decoration
chisen: 桑德拉常在頭髮上紮條絲帶。
engsen: Sandra often wears a ribbon in her hair .

chi: （捆紮或裝飾用的）帶子，絲帶，緞帶
eng: a long, narrow strip of material used to tie things together or as a decoration
chisen: 他用緞帶將禮物包紮起來。
engsen: He tied up the present with ribbon .

eng: to not now have an unwanted or unpleasant task, object, or person
chisen: 我不喜歡批改那些卷子，所以我很高興能免去這一麻煩。
engsen: I didn't enjoy marking those papers and I was glad to be rid of them .

eng: (of fruit or crops) completely developed and ready to be collected or eaten
chisen: 那些香蕉還沒有成熟——還是綠的。
engsen: Those bananas aren't ripe yet - they're still green .

eng: Ripe cheese has developed a strong flavour.
chisen: 這種法國布裡起司味道醇正而濃鬱。
engsen: This brie smells good and ripe .

eng: A ripe smell is strong and unpleasant.
chisen: 他的襪子發出一股刺鼻的味道。
engsen: There was a ripe smell from his socks .

eng: used to describe language that is rude
chisen: 粗俗的笑話
engsen: a ripe joke

eng: the possibility of something bad happening
chisen: 這個行業的風險和回報都很高。
engsen: In this business , the risks and the rewards are high .

eng: the possibility of something bad happening
chisen: 這樣大的霧，很有可能再次出事故。
engsen: There's a high risk of another accident happening in this fog .

eng: the possibility of something bad happening
chisen: 我們可能會失敗，這種憂患意識使得我們加倍努力工作。
engsen: The risk (that) we might fail made us work twice as hard .

eng: to make a long, loud, deep sound
chisen: 我們可以聽到獅子在動物園的另一端咆哮。
engsen: We could hear the lions roaring at the other end of the zoo .

eng: to cook food in an oven or over a fire
chisen: 直接把雞放在烤箱裡烤，烤時塗上油和檸檬汁。
engsen: Just roast the chicken in the oven and baste it in oil and lemon .

eng: to cook food in an oven or over a fire
chisen: 我們躺在地中海的沙灘上曬日光浴。
engsen: We lay on the beach and roasted (= got very hot) in the Mediterranean sun .

eng: to take money or property illegally from a place, organization, or person, often using violence
chisen: 恐怖分子靠搶銀行來獲得資金。
engsen: The terrorists financed themselves by robbing banks .

eng: to take money or property illegally from a place, organization, or person, often using violence
chisen: 我的錢包沒了！我被偷了！
engsen: My wallet's gone ! I've been robbed !

eng: to take money or property illegally from a place, organization, or person, often using violence
chisen: 他們從這間公司盜取了兩百萬英鎊。
engsen: They robbed the company of $2 million .

eng: someone who steals
chisen: 這夥強盜在逃走前開槍打了一名員警。
engsen: The robbers shot a policeman before making their getaway .

eng: the crime of stealing from somewhere or someone
chisen: 這個犯罪團夥承認最近發生的四宗銀行搶劫案是他們做的。
engsen: The gang admitted they had committed four recent bank robberies .

chi: 長袍，罩袍；（尤指特別正式場合穿的）袍服，禮袍
eng: a long, loose piece of clothing worn especially on very formal occasions
chisen: 法官在法庭上都身穿黑袍。
engsen: Judges wear black robes when they are in court .

eng: a large cylinder-shaped object that moves very fast by forcing out burning gases, used for space travel or as a weapon
chisen: 他們向金星發射了一枚火箭。
engsen: They launched a rocket to the planet Venus .

eng: a large cylinder-shaped object that moves very fast by forcing out burning gases, used for space travel or as a weapon
chisen: 叛軍在發射反坦克火箭彈。
engsen: The rebels were firing anti-tank rockets .

eng: relating to love or a close loving relationship
chisen: 言情小說／愛情喜劇
engsen: a romantic novel/comedy

eng: relating to love or a close loving relationship
chisen: 你以前是那麼多情，可現在你從來就不對我說你愛我。
engsen: You used to be so romantic , but now you never tell me that you love me .

eng: relating to love or a close loving relationship
chisen: 我猜他是個很浪漫的人－－他在我的生日送花給我，又說我看起來很漂亮等等。
engsen: I suppose he is quite romantic - he sends me flowers on my birthday and tells me I'm looking beautiful and so on .

eng: to (cause something to) decay
chisen: 水果無人採摘，爛在了樹上。
engsen: The fruit had been left to rot on the trees .

eng: to (cause something to) decay
chisen: 雨水漏了進來，使屋中的木建部分都朽爛了。
engsen: Rain has got in and rotted (away) the woodwork .

eng: to (cause something to) decay
chisen: 爛水果的味道
engsen: the smell of rotting fruit

eng: decayed
chisen: 房間裡一股蔬菜腐爛的味道。
engsen: The room smelled of rotten vegetables .

chi: 高低不平的；崎嶇的；難行的
eng: not even or smooth, often because of being in bad condition
chisen: 那是一條崎嶇的山道，滿是石頭和巨大的坑窪。
engsen: It was a rough mountain road , full of stones and huge holes .

eng: not exact or detailed
chisen: 建築工人畫了張新樓梯草圖。
engsen: The builder did a rough sketch of how the new stairs would look .

eng: not exact or detailed
chisen: 這只是一個大致的推測。
engsen: This is only a rough guess .

eng: not exact or detailed
chisen: 她粗略估算／計算了一下可能的開銷。
engsen: She made a rough estimate/calculation of the likely cost .

chi: 粗暴的，粗野的；猛烈的；充斥暴力的，危險的
eng: dangerous or violent
chisen: 城內的危險區
engsen: a rough area of town

chi: 粗暴的，粗野的；猛烈的；充斥暴力的，危險的
eng: dangerous or violent
chisen: 其他的男孩子們非常粗野，總是尋釁打架。
engsen: The other boys were rough , always looking for a fight .

eng: (of the weather or the sea) having strong winds or big waves
chisen: 在波濤洶湧時／狂風大作時／洶湧海浪中／暴風雨天氣裡我總會暈船。
engsen: I'm always seasick if the water/wind/sea/weather is rough .

chi: 艱難的；艱苦的；令人不快的
eng: difficult or unpleasant
chisen: 他剛離了婚，父親又去世了，那一段時間／一個月／一年對他來說是太難熬了。
engsen: He's had a rough time/month/year , what with the divorce and then his father dying .

chi: 艱難的；艱苦的；令人不快的
eng: difficult or unpleasant
chisen: 帶著兩個孩子，又無處安身，日子肯定是很艱難。
engsen: It must be rough to have two kids and nowhere to live .

chi: 不舒服的，不適的，生病的
eng: ill
chisen: 你看上去有點氣色不好——你昨晚喝了多少酒啊？
engsen: You look a bit rough - how much did you have to drink last night ?

eng: a usual or fixed way of doing things
chisen: 工作內容不固定——每天都不同。
engsen: There's no set/fixed routine at work - every day is different .

eng: a usual or fixed way of doing things
chisen: 作爲常規，大多數公司都爲其財産和設備購買損壞或盜竊保險。
engsen: Most companies insure property and equipment against damage or theft as a matter of routine .

eng: a piece of thick heavy cloth smaller than a carpet, used for covering the floor or for decoration
chisen: 我的狗喜歡趴在爐火前的小地毯上。
engsen: My dog loves lying on the rug in front of the fire .

eng: a reddish-brown substance that forms on the surface of iron and steel as a result of reacting with air and water
chisen: 斑斑銹跡
engsen: patches of rust

eng: covered with rust (= metal decay)
chisen: 生銹的汽車／釘子
engsen: a rusty car/nail

eng: If a skill you had is rusty, it is not as good as it was because you have not practised it.
chisen: 我的義大利語現在有點荒疏了。
engsen: My Italian is a bit rusty these days .

chi: 大布袋；麻袋；大紙袋；大塑膠袋
eng: a large bag made of strong cloth, paper, or plastic, used to store large amounts of something
chisen: 玉米裝在大麻袋裡。
engsen: The corn was stored in large sacks .

chi: 大布袋；麻袋；大紙袋；大塑膠袋
eng: a large bag made of strong cloth, paper, or plastic, used to store large amounts of something
chisen: 一袋馬鈴薯／煤／麵粉
engsen: a sack of potatoes/coal/flour

eng: a situation in which someone is removed from their job
chisen: 因爲遲到，他們開除了他。
engsen: They gave him the sack for being late .

eng: a situation in which someone is removed from their job
chisen: 兩名工人因爲在倉庫打架而被解僱了。
engsen: Two workers got the sack for fighting in the warehouse .

eng: an attack on a building or town in which a lot of destruction is caused and many valuable things are stolen
chisen: 西哥德人洗劫羅馬發生在西元五世紀。
engsen: The sack of Rome by the Visigoths occurred in the fifth century .

eng: in American football, an attack on the quarterback that prevents him from throwing the ball
chisen: 小馬隊本賽季只遭受到六次擒殺。
engsen: The Colts have allowed only six sacks this season .

eng: bed
chisen: 時間不早了，我要上床睡覺了。
engsen: It's late - I'm going to hit the sack (= go to bed) .

eng: bed
chisen: 回到家，他發現茱蒂和布拉德睡在同一張床上。
engsen: He came home and found Judy and Brad in the sack (= in bed) together .

chi: 爲了（某人）的利益；爲了幫助（某人）
eng: in order to help or bring advantage to someone
chisen: 爲了大衛，請做這件事。
engsen: Please do it , for David's sake .

chi: 爲了（某人）的利益；爲了幫助（某人）
eng: in order to help or bring advantage to someone
chisen: 他們的父母僅僅是爲了孩子才沒有分開。
engsen: Their parents only stayed together for the sake of the children .

chi: 爲了（某人）的利益；爲了幫助（某人）
eng: in order to help or bring advantage to someone
chisen: 爲了你我著想，我希望你是對的！
engsen: I hope for both our sakes that you're right !

eng: because of, or for the purpose of something
