chisen: 園藝鏟
engsen: a garden spade

eng: a tool used for digging especially soil or sand, with a long handle and a flat blade
chisen: 孩子們帶著他們的桶子和鏟子到海邊去了。
engsen: The kids took their buckets and spades to the beach .

eng: one of the four suits in playing cards, represented by a black symbol like a pointed leaf with a short stem
chisen: 黑桃 A／皇后
engsen: the ace/queen of spades

eng: relating to one thing and not others; particular
chisen: 這種病毒專門攻擊大腦內特定的細胞。
engsen: The virus attacks specific cells in the brain .

eng: relating to one thing and not others; particular
chisen: 這筆錢有特定的用途。
engsen: The money is intended to be used for specific purposes .

eng: relating to one thing and not others; particular
chisen: 這種病似乎是某些植物所特有的。
engsen: The disease seems to be specific to (= only found in) certain types of plant .

eng: clear and exact
chisen: 對於典獄官的行爲，尚未作出明確的指控。
engsen: No specific allegations have yet been made about the prison officers' behaviour .

eng: clear and exact
chisen: 你能不能更具體一點說你的背哪裡痛？
engsen: Can you be more specific about where your back hurts ?

eng: a substance made from a plant, used to give a special flavour to food
chisen: 肉桂、薑和丁香都屬於香料。
engsen: Cinnamon , ginger , and cloves are all spices .

eng: a substance made from a plant, used to give a special flavour to food
chisen: 南亞菜中廣泛使用各種調味香料。
engsen: Spices are widely used in South Asian cooking .

chi: 調劑品；額外的刺激（或趣味）
eng: something that makes something else more exciting and interesting
chisen: 一兩條醜聞爲辦公室生活平添了一點樂趣。
engsen: A scandal or two adds a little spice to office life .

chi: （使）灑出；（使）流出；（使）濺出； （使）湧出
eng: to (cause to) flow, move, fall, or spread over the edge or outside the limits of something
chisen: 我把咖啡灑到絲綢襯衫上了。
engsen: I spilled coffee on my silk shirt .

chi: （使）灑出；（使）流出；（使）濺出； （使）湧出
eng: to (cause to) flow, move, fall, or spread over the edge or outside the limits of something
chisen: 你把甚麽東西灑在領帶上了。
engsen: You've spilled something down your tie .

chi: （使）灑出；（使）流出；（使）濺出； （使）湧出
eng: to (cause to) flow, move, fall, or spread over the edge or outside the limits of something
chisen: 來試試看我能不能一滴不漏地把果汁倒進玻璃杯裡。
engsen: Let's see if I can pour the juice into the glass without spilling it .

eng: to force out the contents of the mouth, especially saliva
chisen: 他們買了西瓜，邊走邊吃，一路吐著西瓜籽。
engsen: They bought watermelons and ate them as they walked , spitting out the seeds .

eng: to rain very slightly
chisen: 如果只是一點毛毛細雨，也許我們不用穿雨衣。
engsen: If it's only spitting (with rain) , perhaps we don't need waterproofs .

eng: (used before one fact that makes another fact surprising) despite
chisen: 儘管裡卡多有傷在身，星期六的比賽他仍然會出場。
engsen: In spite of his injury , Ricardo will play in Saturday's match .

eng: a feeling of anger towards another person that makes someone want to annoy, upset, or hurt them, especially in a small way
chisen: 他是那種會爲了泄憤而讓你車胎洩氣的人。
engsen: He's the sort of man who would let down the tyres on your car just out of/from spite .

eng: to destroy or reduce the pleasure, interest, or beauty of something
chisen: 他努力不讓那個壞消息破壞他晚上的興致。
engsen: He tried not to let the bad news spoil his evening .

eng: to destroy or reduce the pleasure, interest, or beauty of something
chisen: 溢出的石油破壞了整段漂亮的海岸線。
engsen: The oil spill has spoiled the whole beautiful coastline .

eng: to destroy or reduce the pleasure, interest, or beauty of something
chisen: 我還沒看那部電影，所以別把內容告訴我，以免壞了我的興致。
engsen: I haven't seen the film , so don't spoil it for me by telling me what happens .

chi: （尤指極其慷慨地）寵愛，溺愛，縱容
eng: to treat someone very or too well, especially by being extremely generous
chisen: 我心情糟糕的時候，就會去購物放縱一下——買上幾件新衣服總會讓我感覺好過些。
engsen: When I'm feeling miserable I go shopping and spoil myself - a couple of new dresses always make me feel better .

eng: to allow a child to do or have everything that it wants to, usually so that it expects to get everything it wants and does not show respect to other people
chisen: 哈維先生只此一次不能如願以償按他的意思做，就氣呼呼的，像個寵壞了的孩子。
engsen: Mr Harvey , unable for once to do exactly as he wanted , sulked just like a spoiled child .

eng: to cause an injury to a joint (= a place where two bones are connected) by a sudden movement
chisen: 她打壁球扭傷了腳踝。
engsen: She sprained her ankle playing squash .

eng: a mass of very small drops of liquid carried in the air
chisen: 你能感覺到海上的浪花／瀑布濺起的水霧嗎？
engsen: Can you feel the spray from the sea/waterfall ?

eng: a single small branch or stem with leaves and flowers on it
chisen: 所有參加婚禮的來賓都戴著小枝康乃馨。
engsen: All the wedding guests wore sprays of carnations .

eng: to drop a few pieces or drops of something over a surface
chisen: 在披薩上撒些香料調味。
engsen: Sprinkle a few herbs on the pizza./Sprinkle the pizza with a few herbs .

eng: to drop a few pieces or drops of something over a surface
chisen: 這場演講多次拿那件事開玩笑。
engsen: The speech was liberally sprinkled with (= contained many) jokes about the incident .

eng: firmly fixed or not likely to move or change
chisen: 如果房子的地基不穩，就有可能倒塌。
engsen: If the foundations of the house aren't stable , collapse is possible .

eng: firmly fixed or not likely to move or change
chisen: 做了幾份兼職工作之後，他目前在銀行找到了一份穩定的工作。
engsen: After several part-time jobs , he's now got a stable job in a bank .

eng: firmly fixed or not likely to move or change
chisen: 院方說她手術之後情況穩定。
engsen: The hospital said she was in a stable condition (= not likely to get worse) following the operation .

eng: a large closed area of land with rows of seats around the sides and often with no roof, used for sports events and musical performances
chisen: 成千上萬的球迷湧進體育場觀看比賽。
engsen: Thousands of fans packed into the stadium to watch the match .

eng: a large closed area of land with rows of seats around the sides and often with no roof, used for sports events and musical performances
chisen: 新國家體育場的啟用
engsen: the opening of a new national stadium (= where a country's team plays its home games)

eng: the group of people who work for an organization
chisen: 學校裡教職員工和學生的關係很融洽。
engsen: There is a good relationship between staff and pupils at the school .

eng: the group of people who work for an organization
chisen: 員工們對最近一次加薪不太滿意。
engsen: The staff are not very happy about the latest pay increase .

eng: the group of people who work for an organization
chisen: 公司有100多名員工。
engsen: There are over a hundred staff in the company .

chi: （尤指驚訝、害怕或思考時）盯著看，凝視，注視
eng: to look for a long time with the eyes wide open, especially when surprised, frightened, or thinking
chisen: 不要那樣盯著人看，很不禮貌。
engsen: Don't stare at people like that , it's rude .

chi: （尤指驚訝、害怕或思考時）盯著看，凝視，注視
eng: to look for a long time with the eyes wide open, especially when surprised, frightened, or thinking
chisen: 查克靜靜地坐了幾個鐘頭，凝視著遠方，尋思著事情本來可能會有的另一番發展。
engsen: Chuck sat quietly for hours staring into the distance , thinking of what might have been .

chi: （尤指驚訝、害怕或思考時）盯著看，凝視，注視
eng: to look for a long time with the eyes wide open, especially when surprised, frightened, or thinking
chisen: 記者招待會上兩位拳擊手都瞪大雙眼直視對方，想把對方壓倒。
engsen: During the press conference , each boxer tried to stare the other down (= force the other to look away by continual staring) .

eng: to (cause someone to) become very weak or die because there is not enough food to eat
chisen: 在這場漫長的大旱中，整個村落的人都餓死了。
engsen: Whole communities starved to death during the long drought .

eng: to (cause someone to) become very weak or die because there is not enough food to eat
chisen: 透過和從集中營出來的囚犯談話，一個很明顯的感覺就是他們一直在挨餓。
engsen: From talking to former prisoners in the camps , an obvious conclusion is that they have been starved .

chi: （尤指石頭或金屬的）雕像，雕塑，塑像
eng: an object made from a hard material, especially stone or metal, to look like a person or animal
chisen: 一尊男孩雕像
engsen: a statue of a boy

chi: （尤指石頭或金屬的）雕像，雕塑，塑像
eng: an object made from a hard material, especially stone or metal, to look like a person or animal
chisen: 他們計劃為總統設一尊雕像。
engsen: They planned to put up/erect a statue to the president .

chi: 穩步的；持續的；有規律的
eng: happening in a smooth, gradual, and regular way, not suddenly or unexpectedly
chisen: 隊伍穩步穿過街道。
engsen: The procession moved through the streets at a steady pace .

chi: 穩步的；持續的；有規律的
eng: happening in a smooth, gradual, and regular way, not suddenly or unexpectedly
chisen: 新船的訂單數量經過幾年的持續下降之後開始增加了。
engsen: Orders for new ships are rising , after several years of steady decline .

chi: 穩步的；持續的；有規律的
eng: happening in a smooth, gradual, and regular way, not suddenly or unexpectedly
chisen: 過去十年，他連續發表了一系列文章和論文。
engsen: Over the last ten years he has produced a steady flow/stream/trickle of articles and papers .

chi: 固定不動的；穩固的，平穩的
eng: not moving or changing suddenly
chisen: 我把船穩住，你爬上來。
engsen: I'll hold the boat steady while you climb in .

chi: 固定不動的；穩固的，平穩的
eng: not moving or changing suddenly
chisen: 今年大部分租金保持不變。
engsen: Most rental prices have held steady this year .

chi: 固定不動的；穩固的，平穩的
eng: not moving or changing suddenly
chisen: 年輕人想當然地認為，只要保持穩定的戀愛關係，就不必擔心愛滋病病毒。
engsen: Young people assume that if you are in a steady relationship , you don't have to worry about HIV .

eng: under control
chisen: 冷靜的聲音／表情／目光
engsen: a steady voice/look/gaze

eng: under control
chisen: 在市內開車需要沉著冷靜。
engsen: You need steady nerves to drive in city traffic .

eng: under control
chisen: 畫這些小細節手要穩。
engsen: Painting these small details needs a steady hand .

eng: (of a slope) rising or falling at a sharp angle
chisen: 陡坡
engsen: a steep slope

eng: (of a slope) rising or falling at a sharp angle
chisen: 爬上山頂的路非常陡，不過風景非常好，值得一爬。
engsen: It's a steep climb to the top of the mountain , but the view is worth it .

eng: (of a slope) rising or falling at a sharp angle
chisen: 城堡坐落在陡峭的山／山坡上。
engsen: The castle is set on a steep hill/hillside .

chi: （尤指價格）過高的，高得離譜的
eng: (especially of prices) too much, or more than is reasonable
chisen: 他們得面對非常高的稅金。
engsen: They are having to face very steep taxes .

chi: （尤指價格）過高的，高得離譜的
eng: (especially of prices) too much, or more than is reasonable
chisen: 我們喜歡這家餐廳的東西，但價格高得有點離譜了。
engsen: We enjoyed our meal at the restaurant , but the bill was a bit steep .

chi: （尤指價格）過高的，高得離譜的
eng: (especially of prices) too much, or more than is reasonable
chisen: 高爾夫球俱樂部的會費相當高。
engsen: The membership fees at the golf club are pretty steep .

eng: a way of recording or playing sound so that it is separated into two signals and produces more natural sound
chisen: 音樂會將用立體聲播放。
engsen: The concert will be broadcast in stereo .

chi: 黏性的；黏的；塗有黏膠的
eng: made of or covered with a substance that stays attached to any surface it touches
chisen: 黏膠帶
engsen: a sticky mess

chi: 黏性的；黏的；塗有黏膠的
eng: made of or covered with a substance that stays attached to any surface it touches
chisen: 我把果汁灑到地上，現在那裡還黏乎乎的。
engsen: The floor's still sticky where I spilled the juice .

chi: 黏性的；黏的；塗有黏膠的
eng: made of or covered with a substance that stays attached to any surface it touches
chisen: 孩子們的臉上沾滿了巧克力，黏乎乎的。
engsen: The children's faces were sticky with chocolate .

eng: difficult
chisen: 會議過程中有幾處困難，但最後總算是一切順利。
engsen: There were a few sticky moments during the meeting , but everything turned out all right in the end .

chi: 持有異議的，抱不合作態度的
eng: unwilling to agree
chisen: 他們的銀行經理不願意借給他們那筆錢。
engsen: Their bank manager was sticky about lending them the money they wanted to borrow .

eng: firm or hard
chisen: 硬領
engsen: a stiff collar

eng: firm or hard
chisen: 他衣服上的泥巴乾了，硬邦邦的。
engsen: His clothes were stiff with dried mud .

eng: firm or hard
chisen: 這種髮膠使我的頭髮變硬。
engsen: This hair spray has made my hair stiff .

eng: behaving in a way that is formal and not relaxed
chisen: 將軍是個戴著金屬框眼鏡的高個男子，態度生硬，相當傲慢。
engsen: The general is a tall man with steel spectacles and a stiff , pompous manner .

eng: severe and difficult
chisen: 這名運動員因服用違禁藥物受到嚴厲懲罰。
engsen: The athlete was given a stiff punishment for using drugs .

eng: severe and difficult
chisen: 增加稅收的提案遭到強烈反對／抵制。
engsen: There has been stiff opposition/resistance to the proposed tax increases .

eng: severe and difficult
chisen: 要爬上山頂很費勁。
engsen: It's a stiff climb to the top of the hill .

eng: If an insect, plant, or animal stings, it produces a small but painful injury, usually with a poison, by brushing against the skin or making a very small hole in the skin.
chisen: 所有種類的蜜蜂都蜇人嗎？
engsen: Do all types of bee sting ?

eng: to mix a liquid or other substance by moving an object such as a spoon in a circular pattern
chisen: 慢慢攪動醬汁直至煮沸。
engsen: Stir the sauce gently until it begins to boil .

eng: to mix a liquid or other substance by moving an object such as a spoon in a circular pattern
chisen: 將蛋黃攪拌至混合料中。
engsen: Stir the egg yolks into the mixture .

eng: to mix a liquid or other substance by moving an object such as a spoon in a circular pattern
chisen: 她停了一下，往咖啡裡摻了點牛奶。
engsen: She paused to stir some milk into her coffee .

eng: to move or to cause something to move slightly
chisen: 微風吹動小徑上的落葉。
engsen: A light breeze stirred the leaves lying on the path .

eng: to move or to cause something to move slightly
chisen: 我吻他的時候，他在睡夢中動了一下。
engsen: He stirred in his sleep as I kissed him .

eng: If something stirs you, it makes you feel a strong emotion.
chisen: 她的表演深深打動了我。
engsen: I was deeply stirred by her performance .

eng: If something stirs you, it makes you feel a strong emotion.
chisen: 這番講話激勵人們開始採取行動。
engsen: The speech stirred the crowd to take action .

eng: a piece of thread sewn in cloth, or the single movement of a needle and thread into and out of the cloth that produces this
chisen: 縫上幾針，把兩塊布縫在一起。
engsen: Secure the two pieces together with a couple of stitches .

chi: （常因跑步或大笑時呼吸不足引起的）肋部刺痛；岔氣
eng: a sharp pain in the side of your stomach or chest, often caused by not breathing enough when running or laughing
chisen: 我追公車追得岔了氣。
engsen: I got a stitch after running for the bus .

eng: a seat without any support for the back or arms
chisen: 吧檯／廚房／鋼琴凳
engsen: a bar/kitchen/piano stool

eng: a seat without any support for the back or arms
chisen: 三腳凳
engsen: a three-legged stool

eng: a piece of solid waste from the body
chisen: 他告訴醫生他便血。
engsen: He told the doctor he had been passing bloody stools .

eng: with strong wind, heavy rain, and often thunder and lightning
chisen: 天空陰沉，暴風雨即將來臨。
engsen: The sky was dark and stormy .

chi: 猛烈的；激烈的；爭吵的；群情激憤的
eng: involving a lot of strong argument and shouting
chisen: 激烈的辯論
engsen: a stormy debate

chi: 猛烈的；激烈的；爭吵的；群情激憤的
eng: involving a lot of strong argument and shouting
chisen: 他們兩人的關係充滿激情，但又衝突不斷。
engsen: They had a passionate and often stormy relationship .

chi: 戰略；策略；計謀；行動計劃；策劃，部署
eng: a detailed plan for achieving success in situations such as war, politics, business, industry, or sport, or the skill of planning for such situations
chisen: 總統昨天召開緊急會議，跟五角大廈商討軍事戰略。
engsen: The president held an emergency meeting to discuss military strategy with the Pentagon yesterday .

chi: 戰略；策略；計謀；行動計劃；策劃，部署
eng: a detailed plan for achieving success in situations such as war, politics, business, industry, or sport, or the skill of planning for such situations
chisen: 他們對這個產品採取的市場策略包括盡可能去爭取免費的宣傳機會。
engsen: Their marketing strategy for the product involves obtaining as much free publicity as possible .

chi: 戰略；策略；計謀；行動計劃；策劃，部署
eng: a detailed plan for achieving success in situations such as war, politics, business, industry, or sport, or the skill of planning for such situations
chisen: 我們正在制訂新策略來增加我們的市場佔有率。
engsen: We're working on new strategies to improve our share of the market .

eng: the ability to do things that need a lot of physical or mental effort
chisen: 她有領先並奪金的體力和耐力。
engsen: She had the strength and stamina to take the lead and win the gold medal .

eng: the ability to do things that need a lot of physical or mental effort
chisen: 自己承認犯錯所顯現的是堅強，而不是軟弱。
engsen: Admitting you've made a mistake is a sign of strength , not weakness .

eng: the ability to do things that need a lot of physical or mental effort
chisen: 他拒絕接受賄賂，表現出崇高的人格。
engsen: He showed great strength of character when he refused to accept the bribes .

eng: a good characteristic
chisen: 她非常清楚自己作為一個藝術家的優點和不足。
engsen: She's well aware of her strengths and weaknesses as an artist .

eng: a good characteristic
chisen: 他最大的長處是他的決斷力和適應力。
engsen: His greatest strengths are his determination and resilience .

eng: the number of people in a group
chisen: 城市目前的警力有多少人？
engsen: What's the current strength of the city's police force ?

chi: 除去，剝除，撕掉（外皮或表層）
eng: to remove, pull, or tear the covering or outer layer from something
chisen: 由於受到污染，樹木的表皮幾乎完全剝落。
engsen: Because of the pollution , the trees are almost completely stripped of bark .

chi: 除去，剝除，撕掉（外皮或表層）
eng: to remove, pull, or tear the covering or outer layer from something
chisen: 漆面太糟，我們決定鏟去所有油漆，重漆一遍。
engsen: The paintwork was so bad that we decided to strip off all the paint and start again .

chi: 除去，剝除，撕掉（外皮或表層）
eng: to remove, pull, or tear the covering or outer layer from something
chisen: 夏天的幾個月裡，羊群把山上啃得光禿禿的。
engsen: During the summer months , the sheep strip the mountains bare .

eng: to remove your clothing, or to remove all the clothing of someone else
chisen: 那些男人被命令把衣服脫光。
engsen: The men were ordered to strip .

eng: to remove your clothing, or to remove all the clothing of someone else
chisen: 他突然脫掉衣服衝進大海。
engsen: Suddenly he stripped off and ran into the sea .

eng: to remove your clothing, or to remove all the clothing of someone else
chisen: 他被脫光衣服，遭受毆打，東西還被搶了。
engsen: He had been stripped naked , beaten and robbed .

chi: 拆卸，拆開（機器、車輛或引擎 ）
eng: to remove parts of a machine, vehicle, or engine in order to clean or repair it
chisen: 我已經決定把機車拆開重新組裝。
engsen: I've decided to strip down my motorbike and rebuild it .

eng: the way in which the parts of a system or object are arranged or organized, or a system arranged in this way
chisen: 句子的文法結構
engsen: the grammatical structure of a sentence

eng: the way in which the parts of a system or object are arranged or organized, or a system arranged in this way
chisen: 這種蛋白質的結構特別複雜。
engsen: The structure of this protein is particularly complex .

eng: the way in which the parts of a system or object are arranged or organized, or a system arranged in this way
chisen: 他們的管理體系非常落伍。
engsen: They have a very old-fashioned management structure .

chi: 結構體；（尤指）大型建築物
eng: something that has been made or built from parts, especially a large building
chisen: 擬議建造的新辦公大樓是一棟高43層的鋼鐵玻璃結構的建築物。
engsen: The proposed new office tower is a steel and glass structure 43 storeys high .

eng: A stubborn person is determined to do what he or she wants and refuses to do anything else.
chisen: 他們倆吵得很兇，因為他們兩個人都很固執。
engsen: They have huge arguments because they're both so stubborn .

chi: （電視或廣播節目的）攝影棚，播音室；（音樂）錄音室
eng: a room with special equipment where television or radio programmes or music recordings are made
chisen: 她在錄音室裡花了3個月錄製自己的最新專輯。
engsen: She spent three months in the studio working on her latest album .

chi: （電視或廣播節目的）攝影棚，播音室；（音樂）錄音室
eng: a room with special equipment where television or radio programmes or music recordings are made
chisen: 攝影棚現場的觀眾
engsen: a studio audience (= people who watch a programme while it is being made in the studio)

eng: a substance, especially when you do not know or say exactly what it is
chisen: 椅子上到處都是黏乎乎的東西。
engsen: There's sticky stuff all over the chair .

eng: a substance, especially when you do not know or say exactly what it is
chisen: 這個黑東西是什麼？
engsen: What's this black stuff ?

eng: a substance, especially when you do not know or say exactly what it is
chisen: 他大量地喝茶——他喜歡這東西。
engsen: He drinks gallons of tea - he loves the stuff .

eng: someone's skill or great abilities
chisen: 埃弗裡投球技術很好，三次投球都很有把握。
engsen: Avery had great stuff , total command of all three of his pitches .

eng: someone's skill or great abilities
chisen: 面試是展示你能力的機會。
engsen: An interview is a chance to show your stuff .

chi: 做事方式；（尤指）風格，作風
eng: a way of doing something, especially one that is typical of a person, group of people, place, or period
chisen: 瓊斯喜歡那種充滿活力、事事親力親為的管理風格。
engsen: Jones favours a dynamic , hands-on style of management .

chi: 做事方式；（尤指）風格，作風
eng: a way of doing something, especially one that is typical of a person, group of people, place, or period
chisen: 他的辦公室在風格上講究實用，沒有任何裝飾。
engsen: His office is very utilitarian in style , with no decoration .

chi: （尤指服裝上的）風尚，潮流，流行式樣
eng: fashion, especially in clothing
chisen: 時裝顧問
engsen: a style consultant

chi: （尤指服裝上的）風尚，潮流，流行式樣
eng: fashion, especially in clothing
chisen: 我常看報紙的時尚版，以跟上最新的潮流。
engsen: I read the fashion pages in the newspapers to keep up with the latest styles .

chi: （尤指服裝上的）風尚，潮流，流行式樣
eng: fashion, especially in clothing
chisen: 典雅的黑色連衣裙永遠都不會過時。
engsen: The classic black dress is always in style .

eng: a particular shape or design, especially of a person's hair, clothes, or a piece of furniture
chisen: 式樣正式的帽子
engsen: a formal style of hat

eng: a particular shape or design, especially of a person's hair, clothes, or a piece of furniture
chisen: 她的頭髮剪了個非常漂亮的髮式。
engsen: Her hair was cut in a really nice style .

eng: high quality in appearance, design, or behaviour
chisen: 那輛車非常氣派，但考慮到其造價也就不足為奇。
engsen: That car's got real style , which is no surprise considering how much it cost .

eng: high quality in appearance, design, or behaviour
chisen: 她一旦決定要做甚麼，總是會做得很氣派。
engsen: When she decides to do something , she always does it in/with great style .

eng: material with particular physical characteristics
chisen: 有機／化學物質
engsen: an organic/chemical substance

eng: material with particular physical characteristics
chisen: 哪種物質能夠承受那樣的溫度？
engsen: What sort of substance could withstand those temperatures ?

chi: （某人）所說（或所寫）的最重要的部分，要點
eng: the most important part of what someone has said or written
chisen: 那年稍後，他們這次秘密談話的要點出現在報紙上的一篇文章中。
engsen: Later that year , the substance of their secret conversation appeared in a newspaper article .

eng: an area on the edge of a large town or city where people who work in the town or city often live
chisen: 博士山屬於墨爾本的近郊住宅區。
engsen: Box Hill is a suburb of Melbourne .

eng: an area on the edge of a large town or city where people who work in the town or city often live
chisen: 我們從中產階級的近郊住宅區驅車前往市中心的貧民區。
engsen: We drove from middle-class suburbs to a very poor inner-city area .

eng: to pull in liquid or air through your mouth without using your teeth, or to move the tongue and muscles of the mouth around something inside your mouth, often in order to dissolve it
chisen: 她坐在草地上，用吸管吸著檸檬汁。
engsen: She was sitting on the grass sucking lemonade through a straw .

eng: to pull in liquid or air through your mouth without using your teeth, or to move the tongue and muscles of the mouth around something inside your mouth, often in order to dissolve it
chisen: 我一直到七歲才不再吮大拇指。
engsen: I sucked my thumb until I was seven .

eng: to pull in liquid or air through your mouth without using your teeth, or to move the tongue and muscles of the mouth around something inside your mouth, often in order to dissolve it
chisen: 我試著咂塊薄荷糖來止咳。
engsen: I tried sucking (on) a mint to stop myself coughing .

eng: If someone or something sucks, that person or thing is bad or unpleasant.
chisen: 嗨，這工作太糟了！
engsen: Man , this job sucks !

eng: If someone or something sucks, that person or thing is bad or unpleasant.
chisen: 我弟弟生病時，他所有的雜事都得我來做，真是討厭。
engsen: While my brother was sick , I had to do all of his chores and it sucked .

eng: to experience physical or mental pain
chisen: 我想他妻子離開他時，他一定很痛苦。
engsen: I think he suffered a lot when his wife left him .

eng: to experience physical or mental pain
chisen: 冬天天氣寒冷，她的關節會變得僵硬，這讓她非常難受。
engsen: She suffers in the winter when it's cold and her joints get stiff .

eng: to experience physical or mental pain
chisen: 她患癌症已經兩年了。
engsen: She's been suffering from (= been ill with) cancer for two years .

eng: to experience or show the effects of something bad
chisen: 民主黨在上次選舉中慘敗。
engsen: The Democrats suffered a crushing defeat in the last election .

eng: to experience or show the effects of something bad
chisen: 抗議事件中有25名員警受到輕傷。
engsen: 25 policemen suffered minor injuries during the riots .

eng: to experience or show the effects of something bad
chisen: 當地汽車廠上個月倒閉，這是該市受到的又一打擊。
engsen: The city suffered another blow last month with the closure of the local car factory .

eng: enough for a particular purpose
chisen: 這份食譜應該足夠五個人吃。
engsen: This recipe should be sufficient for five people .

eng: enough for a particular purpose
chisen: 人們都認為他是犯罪兇手，但沒有足夠證據將他定罪。
engsen: It was thought that he'd committed the crime but there wasn't sufficient evidence to convict him .

eng: to mention an idea, possible plan, or action for other people to consider
chisen: 我建議聚會去火車站附近的一家義大利餐館。
engsen: I suggested an Italian restaurant near the station for the party .

eng: to mention an idea, possible plan, or action for other people to consider
chisen: 我建議來一杯白葡萄酒配您的鮭魚吧，先生？
engsen: Might I suggest a white wine with your salmon , sir ?

eng: to mention an idea, possible plan, or action for other people to consider
chisen: 我建議我們在作出任何明確而肯定的決定之前先考慮片刻。
engsen: I suggest (that) we wait a while before we make any firm decisions .

eng: to communicate or show an idea or feeling without stating it directly or giving proof
chisen: 雖然沒有確鑿的證據，但所有證據都表明他有罪。
engsen: There's no absolute proof , but all the evidence suggests (that) he's guilty .

eng: to communicate or show an idea or feeling without stating it directly or giving proof
chisen: 你言下之意是說我穿這條褲子顯得胖？
engsen: Are you suggesting (that) I look fat in these trousers ?

eng: to communicate or show an idea or feeling without stating it directly or giving proof
chisen: 他的舉止流露出的某種暗示意味著他對我們正在做的事情並無興趣。
engsen: Something about his manner suggested a lack of interest in what we were doing .

eng: to produce an idea in the mind
chisen: 你想到甚麼好主意了嗎？
engsen: Does anything suggest itself ? (= Do you have any ideas about what we should do?)

eng: the act of killing yourself intentionally, or a person who has done this
chisen: 企圖自殺／自殺
engsen: to attempt/commit suicide

eng: the act of killing yourself intentionally, or a person who has done this
chisen: 16至25歲之間男性的自殺率攀升速度令人擔憂。
engsen: The suicide rate among men between the ages of 16 and 25 has risen alarmingly .

eng: the act of killing yourself intentionally, or a person who has done this
chisen: 監獄中的自殺事件很多。
engsen: Many suicides occur in prisons .

chi: 自殺性的行為；自取滅亡的行為
eng: any act that has the effect of causing your own defeat
chisen: 他知道作為一位領袖，表現得猶疑不定無疑是在政治上自取滅亡。
engsen: As a leader he knows that it is political suicide to appear indecisive .

eng: acceptable or right for someone or something
chisen: 這部電影不適宜兒童觀看。
engsen: The film is not suitable for children .

eng: acceptable or right for someone or something
chisen: 已經擬定召開會議，但是要找到合適的會場卻很困難。
engsen: A conference was planned , but finding a suitable venue proved difficult .

eng: acceptable or right for someone or something
chisen: 每個房間裡都放有適合特定年齡段的書籍、玩具和遊戲。
engsen: Each room has books , toys , and games that are suitable to that particular age group .

eng: an amount of money
chisen: 巨額的錢財都投入到國防上。
engsen: Huge sums of money are spent on national defence .

eng: an amount of money
chisen: 他把房子賣了一大筆錢。
engsen: He sold the house for a tidy (= large) sum .

eng: an amount of money
chisen: 我整整工作了三週，卻只得到可憐兮兮的100美元。
engsen: I worked for three whole weeks for which I received the princely (= very low) sum of $100 .

eng: the whole number or amount when two or more numbers or amounts have been added together
engsen: The sum of 13 and 8 is 21 .

chi: （尤指運用加減乘除的簡單）計算，算術
eng: a calculation, especially a simple one, using such processes as adding, taking away, multiplying, or dividing
chisen: 我記得我上學的時候非常討厭算術。
engsen: I remember how much I hated doing sums when I was at school .

eng: a short, clear description that gives the main facts or ideas about something
chisen: 在新聞結束的時候，他們常常會總結一下主要的新聞內容。
engsen: At the end of the news , they often give you a summary of the main stories .

eng: a short, clear description that gives the main facts or ideas about something
chisen: 總而言之，他們決定反對這項提議。
engsen: In summary , they decided against the proposal .

chi: 高峰會，領袖會議，最高級會議
eng: an important formal meeting between leaders of governments from two or more countries
chisen: 高峰會議
engsen: a summit meeting

chi: 高峰會，領袖會議，最高級會議
eng: an important formal meeting between leaders of governments from two or more countries
chisen: 世界各國領袖將在下週齊聚一堂，參加一年一度的經濟高峰會。
engsen: World leaders will meet next week for their annual economic summit .

eng: the highest point of a mountain
chisen: 1784年的今天，麥克‧帕卡德醫生和雅克‧巴爾馬特登上了勃朗峰的頂峰。
engsen: On this day in 1784 , Dr Michel Paccard and Jacques Balmat reached the summit of Mont Blanc .

chi: 好於平均的，好過其他的，優越的
eng: better than average or better than other people or things of the same type
chisen: 這顯然是一位優秀藝術家的作品。
engsen: This is clearly the work of a superior artist .

chi: 好於平均的，好過其他的，優越的
eng: better than average or better than other people or things of the same type
chisen: 因為她比其他應徵者更出色，所以她被選中做這份工作。
engsen: She was chosen for the job because she was the superior candidate .

chi: 好於平均的，好過其他的，優越的
eng: better than average or better than other people or things of the same type
chisen: 對嬰兒來說，餵母乳比餵奶瓶好得多。
engsen: For babies , breastfeeding is superior to bottle-feeding .

eng: higher in rank or social position than others
chisen: 這個士兵失職之事被呈報到他的上級那裡。
engsen: The soldier was reported to his superior officer for failing in his duties .

eng: to think that something is likely to be true
chisen: 丹沒有接我的電話，所以我想他應該很忙。
engsen: Dan didn't answer his phone , so I suppose (that) he's busy .

eng: to think that something is likely to be true
chisen: 他發現找工作比他想像的要難多了。
engsen: He found it a lot more difficult to get a job than he supposed it would be .

eng: to think that something is likely to be true
chisen: 你認為吉莉恩會嫁給他嗎?
engsen: Do you suppose (that) Gillian will marry him ?

eng: to expect and need
chisen: 公司今年的利潤要有成長才能進行這樣的投資。
engsen: Investment of this kind supposes (= would not be possible without) an increase in the company's profits this year .

eng: to be everywhere around something
chisen: 白頭積雪的群山環繞著這座城市。
engsen: Snow-capped mountains surround the city .

eng: to be everywhere around something
chisen: 格溫坐在桌前，周圍堆滿了書和報紙。
engsen: Gwen sat at her desk , surrounded by books and papers .

eng: to be everywhere around something
chisen: 史達林去世的確切情況仍是迷霧重重。
engsen: Mystery still surrounds the exact circumstances of Stalin's death .

eng: an examination of opinions, behaviour, etc., made by asking people questions
chisen: 最近的一項調查顯示，有58%的人不知道自己的心臟在甚麼位置。
engsen: A recent survey found/revealed/showed that 58 percent of people did not know where their heart is .

eng: an examination of opinions, behaviour, etc., made by asking people questions
chisen: 進行調查
engsen: to conduct/carry out/do a survey

eng: the measuring and recording of the details of an area of land
chisen: 地質勘測
engsen: a geological survey

eng: the fact of a person, organization, etc. continuing to live or exist
chisen: 醫生告訴我妻子，我有50%生存機會。
engsen: The doctors told my wife I had a 50/50 chance of survival .

eng: the fact of a person, organization, etc. continuing to live or exist
chisen: 他主要關心的還是保住自己的政治前途。
engsen: His main concern is to ensure his own political survival .

eng: the fact of a person, organization, etc. continuing to live or exist
chisen: 這場比賽中，英格蘭隊為繼續存活而戰。
engsen: England are fighting for survival (= trying not to be defeated) in this game .

eng: a person who continues to live, despite nearly dying
chisen: 他是這場空難唯一的倖存者。
engsen: He was the sole (= only) survivor of the plane crash .

eng: a person who continues to live, despite nearly dying
chisen: 她是一位癌症倖存者。
engsen: She's a cancer survivor/a survivor of cancer .

chi: 懷疑，猜想，認為（某事有可能）
eng: to think or believe something to be true or probable
chisen: 目前，警方沒有懷疑是謀殺案件。
engsen: So far , the police do not suspect foul play .

chi: 懷疑，猜想，認為（某事有可能）
eng: to think or believe something to be true or probable
chisen: 我們沒有理由認為他會自殺。
engsen: We had no reason to suspect (that) he might try to kill himself .

chi: 懷疑，猜想，認為（某事有可能）
eng: to think or believe something to be true or probable
chisen: 「你認為她會不會已經告訴他們？」「我想不會／會的。」
engsen: "Do you think she'll have told them?" "I suspect not/so."

eng: to think that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong
chisen: 沒有人知道誰殺了她，但是警方認為她丈夫有嫌疑。
engsen: No one knows who killed her , but the police suspect her husband .

eng: to think that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong
chisen: 警方懷疑他發動兩宗爆炸案。
engsen: The police suspect him of carrying out two bomb attacks .

eng: to think that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong
chisen: 三名嫌疑恐怖分子已經被捕。
engsen: Three suspected terrorists have been arrested .

eng: to not trust; to doubt
chisen: 我沒有理由懷疑她的誠實／忠誠。
engsen: I have no reason to suspect her honesty/loyalty .

eng: to not trust; to doubt
chisen: 我們對他提出這個建議的動機表示懷疑。
engsen: We suspected his motives in making his offer .

eng: a belief or idea that something may be true
chisen: 我懷疑是我哥哥說服他約我出去的。
engsen: I have a suspicion that he only asked me out because my brother persuaded him to .

eng: a belief or idea that something may be true
chisen: 她心煩意亂地猜想／心裡暗想自己可能把信寄錯了地址。
engsen: She had a nagging/sneaking suspicion that she might have sent the letter to the wrong address .

eng: a feeling or belief that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong
chisen: 警官說：「你涉嫌非法持有毒品，我將拘捕你。」
engsen: "I'm arresting you on suspicion of illegally possessing drugs," said the police officer .

eng: a feeling or belief that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong
chisen: 在這些案例中，孩子父母通常受到懷疑。
engsen: In these cases , the parents usually come under suspicion .

eng: a feeling or belief that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong
chisen: 她涉嫌謀殺。
engsen: She is under suspicion of murder .

eng: doubt or lack of trust
chisen: 自從他的同事知道了他的真實背景，就不再信任他。
engsen: Since they discovered the truth about his background , his colleagues have regarded him with suspicion .

eng: doubt or lack of trust
chisen: 他們覺得她對他們的政見心存懷疑。
engsen: They feel that she harbours (= has) suspicions of their politics .

eng: a small amount
chisen: 他只是微微一笑。
engsen: He gave just a suspicion of a smile .

eng: a small amount
chisen: 我有點疑慮，不知該不該接受他的邀請。
engsen: I have a suspicion of doubt about whether I should accept his invitation or not .

eng: to use words that are rude or offensive as a way of emphasizing what you mean or as a way of insulting someone or something
chisen: 我第一次聽見母親罵臟話時，覺得非常震驚。
engsen: It was a real shock , the first time I heard my mother swear .

eng: to use words that are rude or offensive as a way of emphasizing what you mean or as a way of insulting someone or something
chisen: 當計程車司機開口對他罵臟話時，他走開了。
engsen: When the cab driver started to swear at him , he walked away .

eng: to promise or say firmly that you are telling the truth or that you will do something or behave in a particular way
chisen: 我發誓我對所發生的事一無所知。
engsen: I don't know anything about what happened , I swear (it) .

eng: to promise or say firmly that you are telling the truth or that you will do something or behave in a particular way
chisen: 你可能覺得這難以置信，但我發誓，那個人確實走過來把這些錢給了我。
engsen: You might find it difficult to believe , but I swear (that) the guy just came up to me and gave me the money .

eng: to promise or say firmly that you are telling the truth or that you will do something or behave in a particular way
chisen: 新的幫會成員必須發誓在任何時候都服從幫會頭目。
engsen: New gang members must swear to obey the gang leaders at all times .

eng: the clear, salty liquid that you pass through your skin
chisen: 經過整個上午的彩排，舞蹈演員們都大汗淋漓。
engsen: The dancers were dripping with/pouring with sweat after a morning's rehearsal .

eng: the clear, salty liquid that you pass through your skin
chisen: 爬到山頂的時候，我們渾身是汗。
engsen: By the time we'd climbed to the top of the hill , we were covered in sweat .

eng: the clear, salty liquid that you pass through your skin
chisen: 她擦了擦額頭上的汗珠。
engsen: She wiped the beads (= drops) of sweat from her forehead .

eng: to become larger and rounder than usual; to (cause to) increase in size or amount
chisen: 她的腳趾顯然已經骨折，因為立刻腫起來了。
engsen: It was obvious she had broken her toe , because it immediately started to swell (up) .

eng: to become larger and rounder than usual; to (cause to) increase in size or amount
chisen: 這個團體招募了更多會員，總人數已超過130萬人。
engsen: The group recruited more members , swelling its ranks (= increasing its size) to more than 1.3 million .

eng: to become larger and rounder than usual; to (cause to) increase in size or amount
chisen: 當他站在那裡觀看兒子的畢業典禮時，心中充滿自豪。
engsen: His heart/breast swelled with pride (= he felt very proud) as he stood watching his son graduate .

eng: happening or moving quickly or within a short time, especially in a smooth and easy way
chisen: 警方對暴動人員迅速採取了行動。
engsen: The police took swift action against the rioters .

eng: happening or moving quickly or within a short time, especially in a smooth and easy way
chisen: 感謝您的即時回覆。
engsen: Thank you for your swift reply .

eng: a small device, usually pushed up or down with your finger, that controls and turns on or off an electric current
chisen: 電燈開關
engsen: a light switch

eng: a small device, usually pushed up or down with your finger, that controls and turns on or off an electric current
chisen: 你能打開那個開關嗎？
engsen: Can you flip the switch ?

eng: a set of connected things or devices that operate together
chisen: 中央暖氣系統
engsen: a central heating system

eng: a way of doing things
chisen: 我們必須設計出一套適當的歸檔方法。
engsen: We'll have to develop a better filing system .

eng: a way of doing things
chisen: 在這一體制下，很多人無法投票。
engsen: Under this system , many people were prevented from voting .

eng: a way of doing things
chisen: 美國和英國的法制體系相差甚遠。
engsen: The legal system operates very differently in the US and Britain .

eng: a small, solid piece of medicine
chisen: 一片安眠藥
engsen: a sleeping tablet

eng: a small, solid piece of medicine
chisen: 一片維他命
engsen: a vitamin tablet

eng: a thin, flat, often square piece of hard material such as wood, stone, or metal
chisen: 這首詩刻在一塊石匾上。
engsen: The poem was engraved on a tablet of stone .

eng: a thin, flat, often square piece of hard material such as wood, stone, or metal
chisen: 一塊肥皂
engsen: a tablet of soap

eng: the direction or distance that a boat moves at an angle to the direction of the wind, so that the boat receives the wind on its sails
chisen: 那艘船右舷搶風航行。
engsen: The ship was on the starboard tack .

eng: a small piece of paper, cloth, or metal, on which there is information, tied or stuck onto something larger
chisen: 價格標籤
engsen: a price tag

eng: a type of graffiti (= words and pictures drawn in public places on walls, etc.) that shows who has drawn it and that represents a signature
chisen: 在都市塗鴉中，簽名塗鴉是最常見的。
engsen: The tag is the most commonly seen graffiti in any urban setting .

eng: (especially of animals) not wild or dangerous, either naturally or because of training or long involvement with humans
chisen: 經過幾個月的接觸，那些猴子變得非常溫順了。
engsen: After a few months' contact the monkeys become very tame .

eng: not interesting or exciting
chisen: 較她之前拍攝的其他一些影片，這一部顯得平淡乏味。
engsen: It was a tame film in comparison to some that she's made .

eng: to hit something gently, and often repeatedly, especially making short, sharp noises
chisen: 樹枝輕輕敲打著窗戶。
engsen: The branches tapped against the window .

eng: to hit something gently, and often repeatedly, especially making short, sharp noises
chisen: 我能聽見他用手指輕叩桌子的聲音。
engsen: I could hear him tapping his fingers on the desk .

eng: to hit something gently, and often repeatedly, especially making short, sharp noises
chisen: 我隨著音樂用腳打拍子。
engsen: I was tapping my feet (= hitting the floor gently with my feet) to the music .

eng: to get or make use of something
chisen: 一個多世紀以來，東部的城市透過開發更偏遠地區的水源，擴大了水的供應。
engsen: For more than a century , Eastern cities have expanded their water supplies by tapping ever more remote sources .

eng: to get or make use of something
chisen: 眾多文學才俊匯聚於此，等待出版商慧眼識珠。
engsen: There is a rich vein of literary talent here just waiting to be tapped by publishers .

chi: 在（電話或電報線）上裝竊聽器；竊聽
eng: to use a small device attached to a phone in order to listen secretly to what people are saying
chisen: 他懷疑自己的電話被人竊聽了。
engsen: He suspected that his phone had been tapped .

eng: (an amount of) money paid to the government that is based on your income or the cost of goods or services you have bought
chisen: 他們要提高煙草稅。
engsen: They're increasing the tax on cigarettes .

eng: (an amount of) money paid to the government that is based on your income or the cost of goods or services you have bought
chisen: 減稅總是受歡迎的。
engsen: Tax cuts (= reductions in taxes) are always popular .

eng: (an amount of) money paid to the government that is based on your income or the cost of goods or services you have bought
chisen: 你的稅前／稅後收入是多少？
engsen: What do you earn before/after tax (= before/after you have paid tax on the money you earn) ?

eng: to laugh at someone or say unkind things about them, either because you are joking or because you want to upset that person
chisen: 我上學期間一直討厭別人取笑我的紅頭髮。
engsen: I used to hate being teased about my red hair when I was at school .

eng: to laugh at someone or say unkind things about them, either because you are joking or because you want to upset that person
chisen: 我只是在開玩笑，不是有意要惹你難過的。
engsen: I was just teasing , I didn't mean to upset you .

eng: relating to the knowledge, machines, or methods used in science and industry
chisen: 幾個技術問題
engsen: a few technical problems

eng: a way of doing an activity that needs skill
chisen: 我們開發了一項新技術，用於檢測生產流程中的錯誤。
engsen: We have developed a new technique for detecting errors in the manufacturing process .

eng: a way of doing an activity that needs skill
chisen: 她是個很有創造力的舞蹈演員，但她缺乏一個真正偉大的舞蹈家的技巧。
engsen: She's a wonderfully creative dancer but she doesn't have the technique of a truly great performer .

chi: 技術（學）；應用技術；（尤指）工業技術
eng: (the study and knowledge of) the practical, especially industrial, use of scientific discoveries
chisen: 現代技術很奇妙，是不是？
engsen: Modern technology is amazing , isn't it ?

chi: 技術（學）；應用技術；（尤指）工業技術
eng: (the study and knowledge of) the practical, especially industrial, use of scientific discoveries
chisen: 這個國家所需要的是科技投入方面的長期政策。
engsen: What this country needs is a long-term policy for investment in science and technology .

eng: the tendency to become angry very quickly
chisen: 她很容易發脾氣。
engsen: She has a real temper .

eng: the tendency to become angry very quickly
chisen: 他的脾氣真壞。
engsen: He's got a really bad temper .

eng: the measured amount of heat in a place or in the body
chisen: 把爐子預熱到攝氏200度。
engsen: Preheat the oven to a temperature of 200 degrees Celsius .

eng: the measured amount of heat in a place or in the body
chisen: 最近幾天氣溫突然上升了。
engsen: Temperatures have risen over the past few days (= the weather has become warmer) .

eng: the measured amount of heat in a place or in the body
chisen: 醫生給他做檢查，並量了他的體溫。
engsen: The doctor examined him and took his temperature (= measured it) .

eng: If you say that the temperature in a particular situation is rising, you mean that it is likely to become violent because people have become angry.
chisen: 由於討論雙方各執一詞，氣氛開始變得緊張起來。
engsen: The temperature of the discussion started to rise as each side added its own arguments .

eng: not lasting or needed for very long
chisen: 停火只能暫時解決危機。
engsen: The ceasefire will only provide a temporary solution to the crisis .

eng: to be likely to behave in a particular way or have a particular characteristic
chisen: 在我國這個地區，往往冬季寒冷而夏季溫暖乾燥。
engsen: We tend to get cold winters and warm , dry summers in this part of the country .

eng: to care for something or someone
chisen: 他精心照料他的向日葵。
engsen: He carefully tended his sunflower plants .

eng: to care for something or someone
chisen: 護士細心護理病人的傷口和瘀腫。
engsen: The nurse gently tended the patient's cuts and bruises .

chi: 溫柔的；溫情的；關懷的；慈愛的
eng: gentle, loving, or kind
chisen: 溫柔的眼神／微笑
engsen: a tender look/smile

chi: 溫柔的；溫情的；關懷的；慈愛的
eng: gentle, loving, or kind
chisen: 你需要的是體貼入微的關懷。
engsen: What you need is some tender loving care .

chi: （身體部位）疼痛的，一觸即痛的
eng: (of part of the body) painful, sore, or uncomfortable when touched
chisen: 打針後，我的胳膊一碰就痛。
engsen: My arm was very tender after the injection .

eng: (of meat or vegetables) easy to cut or chew (= crush with the teeth)
chisen: 我的牛排做得很嫩，好極了。
engsen: My steak was beautifully tender .

eng: young
chisen: 他在七歲就被送去上寄宿學校了。
engsen: He was sent off to boarding school at the tender age of seven .

chi: 領土；領域；領地；活動範圍
eng: (an area of) land, or sometimes sea, that is considered as belonging to or connected with a particular country or person
chisen: 他在敵方領土上被擊落。
engsen: He was shot down in enemy territory .

chi: 領土；領域；領地；活動範圍
eng: (an area of) land, or sometimes sea, that is considered as belonging to or connected with a particular country or person
chisen: 聯合國正在向被佔領地區提供援助。
engsen: The UN is sending aid to the occupied territories .

eng: a subject that you know about or have experience in
chisen: 該導演的最新電影又轉回到他所熟悉的題材上。
engsen: The director is back on familiar territory with his latest film .

chi: （書、雜誌等中區別於圖片的）正文，文字材料
eng: the written words in a book, magazine, etc., not the pictures
chisen: 這本書正文有500頁。
engsen: The book has 500 pages of text .

chi: 感謝的；感激的；感到欣慰的
eng: happy or grateful because of something
chisen: 我很慶幸會議沒有開得太久，因為我要回家。
engsen: I was thankful that the meeting didn't last long , because I had to get home .

eng: a formal statement of the rules on which a subject of study is based or of ideas that are suggested to explain a fact or event or, more generally, an opinion or explanation
chisen: 達爾文的進化論
engsen: Darwin's theory of evolution

eng: a formal statement of the rules on which a subject of study is based or of ideas that are suggested to explain a fact or event or, more generally, an opinion or explanation
chisen: 他認為那個洞是隕石墜落形成的。
engsen: He has a theory that the hole was caused by a meteorite .

eng: a need for something to drink
chisen: 成百上千的難民饑渴難耐癱倒在地。
engsen: Hundreds of refugees collapsed from hunger and thirst .

eng: a need for something to drink
chisen: 我醒來時頭痛欲裂，口渴難耐。
engsen: I woke up with a pounding headache and a raging (= extreme) thirst .

eng: a need for something to drink
chisen: 跑了那麼長的路，我渴得要命。
engsen: I've got a terrible thirst after all that running .

eng: a strong wish
chisen: 他總是渴望冒險。
engsen: He's always had a thirst for adventure .

eng: (a length of) a very thin fibre
chisen: 針線
engsen: needle and thread

eng: The thread of a book, discussion, speech, etc. is its story or the way that it develops, one part connecting with another
chisen: 電影的其中一條主線是男孩和他叔叔之間的關係發展。
engsen: One of the main threads of the film is the development of the relationship between the boy and his uncle .

eng: The thread of a book, discussion, speech, etc. is its story or the way that it develops, one part connecting with another
chisen: 我被那個聲音打擾了，忘了剛才在說什麼。
engsen: The sound distracted me and I lost the thread of (= forgot) what I was saying .

eng: a suggestion that something unpleasant or violent will happen, especially if a particular action or order is not followed
chisen: 她父母威脅說，如果她不能提高成績，就要沒收她的手機。
engsen: Her parents carried out their threat to take away her mobile phone if her grades didn't improve .

eng: a suggestion that something unpleasant or violent will happen, especially if a particular action or order is not followed
chisen: 坐牢的可能也沒能嚇住他小偷小摸。
engsen: The threat of jail failed to deter him from petty crime .

eng: a suggestion that something unpleasant or violent will happen, especially if a particular action or order is not followed
chisen: 酒後駕車者對其他路人構成了嚴重威脅。
engsen: Drunken drivers pose a serious threat (= cause a lot of harm) to other road users .

eng: to tell someone that you will kill or hurt them or cause problems if they do not do what you want
chisen: 他們用槍威脅店主。
engsen: They threatened the shopkeeper with a gun .

eng: to tell someone that you will kill or hurt them or cause problems if they do not do what you want
chisen: 他們威脅要殺他，除非他按他們說的去做。
engsen: They threatened to kill him unless he did as they asked .

eng: to touch someone lightly with your fingers, making them slightly uncomfortable and often making them laugh
chisen: 快停下！你令我癢得難受！
engsen: Stop ! You're tickling me !

eng: to touch someone lightly with your fingers, making them slightly uncomfortable and often making them laugh
chisen: 我搔了搔她的腳，她笑了起來。
engsen: I tickled her feet and she laughed .

eng: If something tickles you, you find it funny or it makes you happy.
chisen: 聽到這個消息，我高興得不得了。
engsen: I was tickled pink (= very happy) to hear the news .

eng: the rise and fall of the sea that happens twice every day
chisen: 潮退／漲了。
engsen: The tide is out/in .

eng: a noticeable change in a situation or increase in a particular type of behaviour
chisen: 我們必須想辦法阻止日益高漲的抗議活動。
engsen: We must look for ways of stemming (= stopping) the rising tide of protest .

chi: 整齊的；整潔的，有條理的
eng: having everything ordered and arranged in the right place, or liking to keep things like this
chisen: 房子乾淨整潔。
engsen: The house was clean and tidy .

chi: 整齊的；整潔的，有條理的
eng: having everything ordered and arranged in the right place, or liking to keep things like this
chisen: 我的室友不怎麼愛整潔。
engsen: My flatmate isn't very tidy .

chi: 整齊的；整潔的，有條理的
eng: having everything ordered and arranged in the right place, or liking to keep things like this
chisen: 整整齊齊
engsen: neat and tidy

eng: (of amounts of money) large
chisen: 他做生意賺了一大筆錢。
engsen: His business deals make him a tidy sum .

chi: 緊的；密封的（地）；牢固的（地）
eng: (held or kept together) firmly or closely
chisen: 我解不開這個結——太緊了。
engsen: I can't untie the knot - it's too tight .

chi: 緊的；密封的（地）；牢固的（地）
eng: (held or kept together) firmly or closely
chisen: 這蓋子蓋得很緊。
engsen: This lid is on very tight .

chi: 緊的；密封的（地）；牢固的（地）
eng: (held or kept together) firmly or closely
chisen: 大家一群群地緊挨著站在那裡說話。
engsen: The people stood talking in tight groups .

eng: to become tighter or to make something become tighter, firmer, or less easy to move
chisen: 把帶子拉緊，這樣它們就不會互相磨擦了。
engsen: Tighten the straps so they don't rub .

eng: to become tighter or to make something become tighter, firmer, or less easy to move
chisen: 他越掙扎，繩子就勒得越緊。
engsen: As he struggled , the ropes tightened even more .

eng: trees that are grown so that the wood from them can be used for building
chisen: 材用林
engsen: a timber forest

eng: trees that are grown so that the wood from them can be used for building
chisen: 這些樹是供材用而栽種的。
engsen: These trees are being grown for timber .

eng: a group of connected cells in an animal or plant that are similar to each other, have the same purpose, and form the stated part of the animal or plant
chisen: 他臉上嚴重燒傷的地方滿是疤痕。
engsen: His face is covered with scar tissue where he was badly burned .

chi: （尤指擦鼻子用的）紙巾，手巾紙，面紙
eng: soft paper that is used for cleaning, especially your nose, and is thrown away after use, or a small rectangular piece of this
chisen: 我快打噴嚏時，她遞給我一張面紙。
engsen: She handed me a tissue just before I sneezed .

chi: （尤指擦鼻子用的）紙巾，手巾紙，面紙
eng: soft paper that is used for cleaning, especially your nose, and is thrown away after use, or a small rectangular piece of this
chisen: 我總是在車裡放一盒面紙。
engsen: I always keep a box of tissues in the car .

chi: （尤指擦鼻子用的）紙巾，手巾紙，面紙
eng: soft paper that is used for cleaning, especially your nose, and is thrown away after use, or a small rectangular piece of this
chisen: 他用一張面紙擦太陽鏡。
engsen: He used a piece of tissue to clean his sunglasses .

eng: a substance smoked in cigarettes, pipes, etc. that is prepared from the dried leaves of a particular plant
chisen: 受訪者中有28%的人認為應該禁止煙草和酒類廣告。
engsen: 28 percent of people thought that the advertising of tobacco (= tobacco and products made from it , such as cigarettes) and alcohol should be banned .

chisen: 它要賣100多。
engsen: It'll cost you a ton or more .

eng: to throw something carelessly
chisen: 他掃了一眼信就把它丟進了垃圾箱。
engsen: He glanced at the letter and then tossed it into the bin .

eng: to throw something carelessly
chisen: 公牛把他頂到了半空中。
engsen: The bull tossed him up into the air .

eng: to throw something carelessly
chisen: 安德魯將球拋給他。
engsen: Andrew tossed him the ball .

eng: When you toss food you shake or mix small pieces of it together with a sauce or dressing.
chisen: 拌沙拉
engsen: a tossed salad

eng: When you toss food you shake or mix small pieces of it together with a sauce or dressing.
chisen: 奶油拌胡蘿蔔
engsen: carrots tossed in butter

chi: 向後甩（頭髮或身體部位）
eng: If you toss your hair or a part of your body you move it up and back suddenly.
chisen: 她生氣地將頭向後一甩。
engsen: She tossed her head in annoyance .

chi: 向後甩（頭髮或身體部位）
eng: If you toss your hair or a part of your body you move it up and back suddenly.
chisen: 她向後甩了甩頭髮。
engsen: She tossed back her hair .

eng: to throw a coin up into the air and guess which side will land facing up, as a way of making a decision
chisen: 我們擲硬幣來決定誰先去吧。
engsen: Let's toss (a coin) to see who'll go first .

eng: to throw a coin up into the air and guess which side will land facing up, as a way of making a decision
chisen: 「我和你擲硬幣來決定——你要正面還是反面？」
engsen: "I'll toss you for it - heads or tails?"

eng: the business of providing services such as transport, places to stay, or entertainment for people who are on holiday
chisen: 旅遊業是威尼斯的主要產業。
engsen: Tourism is Venice's main industry .

eng: the business of providing services such as transport, places to stay, or entertainment for people who are on holiday
chisen: 相對而言，這些美麗的古城還沒有怎麼受到旅遊業的影響。
engsen: These beautiful old towns have remained relatively untouched by tourism .

eng: someone who visits a place for pleasure and interest, usually while on holiday
chisen: 每年有數百萬遊客來到羅馬。
engsen: Millions of tourists visit Rome every year .

eng: someone who visits a place for pleasure and interest, usually while on holiday
chisen: 每年都有潮水般的遊客湧向地中海。
engsen: Hordes (= very large groups) of tourists flock to the Mediterranean each year .

eng: someone who visits a place for pleasure and interest, usually while on holiday
chisen: 迪士尼樂園是佛羅裡達州的主要旅遊景點之一。
engsen: Disneyworld is one of Florida's major tourist attractions .

eng: to pull a car, boat, etc. along, fastened behind another vehicle or boat
chisen: 汽車拖活動房屋時不能開快車。
engsen: You shouldn't drive fast when your car is towing a caravan .

eng: to pull a car, boat, etc. along, fastened behind another vehicle or boat
chisen: 在發生交通事故的車輛被拖走時，這條道路封閉。
engsen: The road was closed while the vehicles that had been involved in the accident were towed away/off .

eng: to pull a car, boat, etc. along, fastened behind another vehicle or boat
chisen: 受損船隻被拖至安全區。
engsen: The damaged boat was towed to safety .

eng: to find someone or something that was lost
chisen: 員警試圖查出那位把新生嬰兒拋棄在醫院外面的母親。
engsen: The police are trying to trace the mother of a newborn baby found abandoned outside a hospital .

eng: to find someone or something that was lost
chisen: 有人曾看到一名男子離開犯罪現場，但迄今為止，尚未成功追查到該名男子。
engsen: Attempts to trace the whereabouts of a man seen leaving the scene of the crime have so far been unsuccessful .

eng: to find someone or something that was lost
chisen: 他們失蹤的女兒最終在曼徹斯特找到了。
engsen: Their missing daughter was finally traced to (= found in) Manchester .

chi: （把透明紙覆蓋在底樣上）描摹
eng: to copy a drawing or pattern, etc. by drawing over its lines through a thin piece of transparent paper
chisen: 這幅畫是你自己畫的，還是你描摹的？
engsen: Did you draw this picture yourself , or did you trace it ?

chi: （把透明紙覆蓋在底樣上）描摹
eng: to copy a drawing or pattern, etc. by drawing over its lines through a thin piece of transparent paper
chisen: 她透過描摹字母學會了寫自己的名字。
engsen: She learned to write her name by tracing out the letters .

eng: a person who buys and sells things
chisen: 毛料商／糖商
engsen: a wool/sugar trader

eng: a person who buys and sells things
chisen: 他的父親在市場做生意，販賣水果和蔬菜。
engsen: His father is a market trader , selling fruit and vegetables .

chi: 鄉間（山間或林間等）小道
eng: a path through a countryside, mountain, or forest area, often made or used for a particular purpose
chisen: 林間／山間小道
engsen: a forest/mountain trail

chi: 鄉間（山間或林間等）小道
eng: a path through a countryside, mountain, or forest area, often made or used for a particular purpose
chisen: 步行／雪鞋／越野滑雪道
engsen: a walking/snowshoeing/cross-country skiing trail

eng: the smell or series of marks left by a person, animal, or thing as it moves along
chisen: 這些狗經過特別訓練，能夠追蹤狐狸留下的氣味。
engsen: The dogs are trained to follow the trail left by the fox .

eng: the smell or series of marks left by a person, animal, or thing as it moves along
chisen: 他身後留下了一串泥濘的腳印。
engsen: He left a trail of muddy footprints behind him .

eng: the movement of people or goods from one place to another
chisen: 活體動物的運輸
engsen: the transport of live animals

eng: the movement of people or goods from one place to another
chisen: 公司將負責從機場開始的交通安排。
engsen: The company will arrange transport from the airport .

eng: something that is of low quality
chisen: 我簡直不敢相信他這麼聰明的人竟然讀這種垃圾東西！
engsen: I can't believe that someone of his intelligence can read such trash !

eng: something that is of low quality
chisen: 今晚的電視節目盡是些垃圾。
engsen: There's nothing but trash on TV tonight .

eng: an insulting way of referring to a person or people that you have no respect for
chisen: 他中斷了兩人的關係，還罵她是垃圾。
engsen: He finished their relationship , and told her she was trash .

eng: a flat object, usually with raised edges, used for carrying food and drinks
chisen: 她端著一托盤飲料。
engsen: She was carrying a tray of drinks .

chi: （通常因寒冷、害怕或情緒激動）顫抖，發抖
eng: to shake slightly, usually because you are cold, frightened, or very emotional
chisen: 他從水裡出來時，冷得直打哆嗦。
engsen: When he came out of the water , he was trembling with cold .

chi: （通常因寒冷、害怕或情緒激動）顫抖，發抖
eng: to shake slightly, usually because you are cold, frightened, or very emotional
chisen: 她的下嘴唇顫抖，淚水也湧上眼眶。

a

engsen: Johnny was late home and , as usual , I had visions of him lying dead in some alley .

eng: the ability to imagine how a country, society, industry, etc. could develop in the future and to plan for this
chisen: 他缺乏一位資深政治家所應具備的敏銳頭腦和眼光。
engsen: He didn't have the mental agility or vision required for a senior politician .

eng: the ability to imagine how a country, society, industry, etc. could develop in the future and to plan for this
chisen: 很有藝術眼光的人
engsen: a person of great artistic vision

eng: the ability to see
chisen: 她的左眼幾乎失明了。
engsen: She has very little vision in her left eye .

eng: (used when referring to a person) a beautiful and impressive sight
chisen: 那邊的那位美麗的女人就是我的妻子，桑德拉。
engsen: And that vision of loveliness over there is my wife , Sandra .

eng: (used when referring to a person) a beautiful and impressive sight
chisen: 她從睡房裡出來，身穿乳白色絲裙，簡直美極了。
engsen: She emerged from the bedroom , a vision in cream silk .

eng: any of a group of natural substances that are necessary in small amounts for the growth and good health of the body
chisen: 維生素片
engsen: a vitamin pill

eng: any of a group of natural substances that are necessary in small amounts for the growth and good health of the body
chisen: 柳橙富含維生素C。
engsen: Oranges are full of vitamin C .

chi: （描述、記憶等）栩栩如生的，鮮活的，生動的
eng: Vivid descriptions, memories, etc. produce very clear, powerful, and detailed images in the mind
chisen: 他生動地講述／描述了他的獄中生活，他說的常讓人覺得很震驚。
engsen: He gave a very vivid and often shocking account/description of his time in prison .

chi: （描述、記憶等）栩栩如生的，鮮活的，生動的
eng: Vivid descriptions, memories, etc. produce very clear, powerful, and detailed images in the mind
chisen: 他是那種想像力異常豐富的人——每次聽到聲響都以為是有人闖進來了。
engsen: He's one of those people with a very vivid imagination - every time he hears a noise he's convinced it's someone breaking in .

eng: the amount of space that is contained within an object or solid shape
chisen: 你認為這些瓶子中哪個容積最大？
engsen: Which of these bottles do you think has the greater volume ?

eng: the level of sound produced by a television, radio, etc., or the switch or other device controlling this
chisen: 你能把音量調低些嗎？我要睡覺。
engsen: Could you turn the volume down , please , I'm trying to sleep .

eng: the level of sound produced by a television, radio, etc., or the switch or other device controlling this
chisen: 如果你告訴我哪個是音量鈕的話，我會把聲音開大些。
engsen: I'll turn it up if you tell me which one is the volume (= switch) .

eng: one in a set of related books
chisen: 他回憶錄的第二卷將於今年晚些時候面世。
engsen: The second volume of his memoirs will be published later this year .

eng: (especially of a tail or finger) to move from side to side or up and down, especially quickly and repeatedly, or to cause this to happen
chisen: 那條小狗歡快地搖著尾巴。
engsen: The little dog's tail wagged in delight .

eng: (especially of a tail or finger) to move from side to side or up and down, especially quickly and repeatedly, or to cause this to happen
chisen: 他一臉嚴肅地向那兩個男孩晃了晃手指。
engsen: He wagged his finger sternly at the two boys .

chi: （尤指支付給體力勞動者並通常按週計算的）工資，工錢，報酬
eng: a particular amount of money that is paid, usually every week, to an employee, especially one who does work that needs physical skills or strength, rather than a job needing a college education
chisen: 非常低／高的工資
engsen: a very low/high wage

chi: （尤指支付給體力勞動者並通常按週計算的）工資，工錢，報酬
eng: a particular amount of money that is paid, usually every week, to an employee, especially one who does work that needs physical skills or strength, rather than a job needing a college education
chisen: 按小時／日／週／年支付的工資
engsen: an hourly/daily/weekly/annual wage

chi: （尤指支付給體力勞動者並通常按週計算的）工資，工錢，報酬
eng: a particular amount of money that is paid, usually every week, to an employee, especially one who does work that needs physical skills or strength, rather than a job needing a college education
chisen: 他的薪水很不錯，因為他的老闆獎懲公平。
engsen: He gets/earns/is paid a good wage , because he works for a fair employer .

eng: a vehicle with four wheels, usually pulled by horses or oxen, used for transporting heavy goods, especially in the past
chisen: 最早的白人定居者是駕著大篷車穿越美洲大陸的。
engsen: The first white settlers journeyed across America in covered wagons .

eng: to (cause to) wake from sleep
chisen: 我推了推他，但他沒有醒。
engsen: I shook him but he didn't waken .

eng: to (cause to) wake from sleep
chisen: 七點叫醒我，好嗎？
engsen: Waken me at 7.00 , would you ?

eng: to walk around slowly in a relaxed way or without any clear purpose or direction
chisen: 我們整個上午都在老城區閒逛。
engsen: We spent the morning wandering around the old part of the city .

eng: to walk around slowly in a relaxed way or without any clear purpose or direction
chisen: 幾個小時後她被找到了，正在街上徘徊，迷路了。
engsen: She was found several hours later , wandering the streets , lost .

eng: to walk around slowly in a relaxed way or without any clear purpose or direction
chisen: 他剛才還在這裡，現在已經閒逛到別的甚麼地方去了。
engsen: He was here a minute ago but he's wandered off somewhere .

eng: to start talking about a different subject from the one you were originally discussing
chisen: 我們有點離題了。
engsen: We've wandered off/from the point somewhat .

eng: a high temperature that is comfortable but not hot
chisen: 我在毛衣裡穿了一件短袖衫，讓自己更暖和一些。
engsen: I've put a T-shirt on under my sweater for extra warmth .

eng: a friendly and enthusiastic quality in someone or something
chisen: 我還記得他們熱情的歡迎。
engsen: I still remember the warmth of their welcome .

eng: to make someone realize a possible danger or problem, especially one in the future
chisen: 我們被告誡不要吃那種魚，因為可能會導致胃部輕微不適。
engsen: We were warned not to eat the fish which might upset our stomachs .

eng: to make someone realize a possible danger or problem, especially one in the future
chisen: 你有沒有提醒他們會多一個人吃飯？
engsen: Have you warned them (that) there will be an extra person for dinner ?

eng: to make someone realize a possible danger or problem, especially one in the future
chisen: 有人告誡我不要去東海岸，因為那裡遊客爆滿。
engsen: I was warned against/off going to the east coast because it was so full of tourists .

eng: a solid substance containing a lot of fat that becomes soft and melts when warm
chisen: 她注視著蠟從蠟燭邊緣滴落下來。
engsen: She watched the wax as it dripped down the side of the candle .

eng: to (cause to) become less strong, powerful, determined, or effective

engsen: You could see the poor dog weakening daily as the disease spread through its body .

eng: to (cause to) become less strong, powerful, determined, or effective
chisen: 這項法案將嚴重削弱對環境的保護。
engsen: The bill would seriously weaken environmental protections .

eng: to (cause to) become less strong, powerful, determined, or effective
chisen: 我們知道，長時間處在震動狀態會降低飛機零件的強度。
engsen: We know that prolonged exposure to vibration can weaken aircraft components .

eng: a large amount of money or valuable possessions that someone has
chisen: 在成功的經商生涯中，她積累了巨額財富。
engsen: During a successful business career , she accumulated a great amount of wealth .

eng: a large amount of something good
chisen: 吉姆有豐富的教學經驗。
engsen: Jim has a wealth of teaching experience .

eng: a large amount of something good
chisen: 俄羅斯有豐富的煤炭和木材資源。
engsen: Russia has a wealth of coal and timber .

eng: rich
chisen: 他是個非常富有的人。
engsen: He's a very wealthy man .

eng: rich
chisen: 他們那裡自然資源豐富，將來可能會成為一個非常富有的國家。
engsen: With their natural resources they are potentially a very wealthy country .

chi: （尤指為避開障礙）迂迴行進，穿行
eng: to go or make a path by moving quickly and changing direction often, especially to avoid hitting things
chisen: 那個男孩騎著腳踏車在靜止的車流中迂迴穿行。
engsen: The boy weaved through/between/in and out of stationary traffic on a bicycle .

eng: a net used to catch insects, made by a spider from the sticky thread that its body produces
chisen: 我們注視著一隻蜘蛛在三根高高的草莖之間織了一張網。
engsen: We watched a spider spin a web between three tall grass stems .

eng: a net used to catch insects, made by a spider from the sticky thread that its body produces

engsen: Those involved in the fraud created an intricate web of trading companies to hide their activities .

eng: someone who is thin and physically weak or who is weak in character

engsen: He looks like a real weed in those shorts .

eng: (of an injury) to produce liquid such as pus

engsen: The sore is still weeping a lot so you'll have to change the dressing once a day .

eng: a plant whose yellowish-brown grain is used for making flour, or the grain itself
chisen: 小麥是一種為全世界億萬人提供主食的農作物。
engsen: Wheat is a staple crop for millions of people across the world .

eng: a piece of leather or rope that is fastened to a stick, used for hitting animals or people
chisen: 她毫不留情地用長鞭抽打馬匹。
engsen: She lashed the horses mercilessly with her long whip .

eng: a piece of leather or rope that is fastened to a stick, used for hitting animals or people
chisen: 馴獅員打了個響鞭。
engsen: The lion-tamer cracked his whip .

chi: （政黨在議會或立法機關中監督該黨其他黨員在投票時出席並按規定投票的）組織秘書，黨鞭
eng: (in many elected political systems) a member of a political party in a parliament or in the legislature whose job is to make certain that other party members are present at voting time and also to make certain that they vote in a particular way
chisen: 哈格里夫斯就是那位因反對稅收改革而與其黨內的組織秘書產生矛盾的議員。
engsen: Hargreaves is the MP who got into trouble with his party's chief whip for opposing the tax reform .

chi: 吹哨子；（尤指）吹口哨；用口哨吹出
eng: to make a high sound by forcing air through a small hole or passage, especially through the lips, or through a special device held to the lips
chisen: 他一邊工作一邊吹口哨。
engsen: He whistled as he worked .

chi: 吹哨子；（尤指）吹口哨；用口哨吹出
eng: to make a high sound by forcing air through a small hole or passage, especially through the lips, or through a special device held to the lips
chisen: 那些天她穿了裙子，建築工地的男人們一見到她就向她吹口哨。
engsen: On the days when she wore a skirt the men on the building site would whistle at her .

chi: 吹哨子；（尤指）吹口哨；用口哨吹出
eng: to make a high sound by forcing air through a small hole or passage, especially through the lips, or through a special device held to the lips

engsen: Someone was whistling Beatles tunes outside my window .

eng: morally wrong and bad
chisen: 那是件缺德的事。
engsen: It was a wicked thing to do .

eng: morally wrong and bad
chisen: 當然，最後邪惡的巫婆被殺掉了。
engsen: Of course , in the end , the wicked witch gets killed .

eng: excellent
chisen: 那輛車太棒了。
engsen: That car is wicked !

eng: to close one eye for a short time as a way of greeting someone or showing friendliness, sexual interest, etc., or of showing that you are not serious about something you have said

engsen: Laura winked at me as Stephen turned his back .

eng: to close one eye for a short time as a way of greeting someone or showing friendliness, sexual interest, etc., or of showing that you are not serious about something you have said
chisen: 有一陣我以為他是認真的，但是隨即他就沖我擠了擠眼睛。
engsen: For a second I thought he was being serious , but then he winked at me .

eng: to slide something, especially a piece of cloth, over the surface of something else, in order to remove dirt, food, or liquid
chisen: 你有沒有我可以用來擦地板的紙巾？
engsen: Do you have some paper towels that I can wipe the floor with ?

eng: to slide something, especially a piece of cloth, over the surface of something else, in order to remove dirt, food, or liquid
chisen: 我這隨便找塊海綿把桌子上的碎屑擦掉。
engsen: I'll just get a sponge and wipe the crumbs off the table .

eng: to slide something, especially a piece of cloth, over the surface of something else, in order to remove dirt, food, or liquid
chisen: 別用袖子擦鼻子！
engsen: Don't wipe your nose on your sleeve !

eng: the ability to use your knowledge and experience to make good decisions and judgments
chisen: 我當然希望自己隨著年齡的增長而多一些智慧。
engsen: I certainly hope to gain a little wisdom as I grow older .

eng: the ability to use your knowledge and experience to make good decisions and judgments
chisen: 他主持一個每週一次的廣播節目，就各種話題發表自己的看法。
engsen: He hosts a weekly radio programme in which he dispenses wisdom (= gives his opinions) on a variety of subjects .

eng: the ability to use your knowledge and experience to make good decisions and judgments
chisen: 不管出於甚麼情況，將一個孩子與家人分開，我都會懷疑這樣做是否明智。
engsen: I tend to doubt the wisdom of separating a child from its family whatever the circumstances .

eng: to cover or surround something with paper, cloth, or other material
chisen: 她把禮物包起來並用絲帶綁好。
engsen: She wrapped the present and tied it with ribbon .

eng: to cover or surround something with paper, cloth, or other material
chisen: 用錫紙將雞肉包起來，烹飪兩個小時。
engsen: Wrap the chicken in foil and cook it for two hours .

eng: the part of the body between the hand and the arm
chisen: 我打網球時扭傷了手腕。
engsen: I sprained my wrist playing tennis .

eng: to open the mouth wide and take a lot of air into the lungs and slowly send it out, usually when tired or bored
chisen: 我不停打哈欠——肯定是累了。
engsen: I can't stop yawning - I must be tired .

chi: （通常指生氣、疼痛或激動時）叫喊，吼叫（著說）
eng: to shout something or make a loud noise, usually when you are angry, in pain, or excited
chisen: 今天早晨我們的鄰居在互相破口大罵。
engsen: Our neighbours were yelling (obscenities) at each other this morning .

chi: （通常指生氣、疼痛或激動時）叫喊，吼叫（著說）
eng: to shout something or make a loud noise, usually when you are angry, in pain, or excited
chisen: 孩子痛得大叫起來。
engsen: The child yelled out in pain .

chi: （通常指生氣、疼痛或激動時）叫喊，吼叫（著說）
eng: to shout something or make a loud noise, usually when you are angry, in pain, or excited
chisen: 「滾出去！」她大吼道。
engsen: "Just get out of here!" she yelled .

eng: the yellow, middle part of an egg
chisen: 我喜歡煮得嫩些的雞蛋，這樣蛋黃還是溏心的。
engsen: I like eggs lightly cooked so that the yolk is still runny .

eng: the yellow, middle part of an egg
chisen: 將蛋黃從蛋白中分離出來。
engsen: Separate the yolks from the whites .

eng: a young person, usually an older child
chisen: 該方案適用於年齡介乎10至16歲之間的少年兒童。
engsen: The scheme is for youngsters between the ages of ten and 16 .

eng: a device consisting of two rows of metal or plastic teeth-like parts that are brought together by pulling a small sliding piece over them, used for closing openings in clothing, bags, etc.
chisen: 拉上／拉開拉鏈
engsen: to pull a zipper up/down

eng: a device consisting of two rows of metal or plastic teeth-like parts that are brought together by pulling a small sliding piece over them, used for closing openings in clothing, bags, etc.
chisen: 我的袋子打不開——拉鏈卡住了。
engsen: I can't open my bag - the zipper is stuck .

chi: （尤指有不同特徵或用途的）地帶，地區
eng: an area, especially one that is different from the areas around it because it has different characteristics or is used for different purposes
chisen: 地震帶
engsen: an earthquake zone

chi: （尤指有不同特徵或用途的）地帶，地區
eng: an area, especially one that is different from the areas around it because it has different characteristics or is used for different purposes
chisen: 無核區
engsen: a nuclear-free zone

chi: （尤指有不同特徵或用途的）地帶，地區
eng: an area, especially one that is different from the areas around it because it has different characteristics or is used for different purposes
chisen: 他被指控在限速55英里的區域內駕車時速達到75英里。
engsen: He was charged with driving at 75 mph in a 55 mph zone .
